AD_NightsongCallsLorroakan.synopsis: One liner when Nightsong lands in Ramazith's Tower balcony and charges to the center to face Lorroakan
AD_NightsongCallsLorroakan.how_to_trigger: After talking to Lorroakan, go to camp and let Nightsong know of the plot, making her go to Ramazith's. After aprox 10s, she should appear in 4991; 1; 704 saying this line.

KlankCheckpoint.synopsis: Klank is making the player leave

NightsongCaged.synopsis: One liner in which Nightsong is caged in Lorroakan's Soul Cage
NightsongCaged.how_to_trigger: Interact with nightsong in the cage after defeating her in ramazith's tower, having lorroakan survive and have a long rest.

NecromancyBuyer.synopsis: One liner with a customer in Sorcerous Sundries that is talking to a necromantic vendor about buying scrolls that allow raising dead.

PAD_NightsongGoesToRamazith.synopsis: PAD onliner that triggers when players end dialog with Nightsong in camp warning her of Lorroakan's looking for her, making her go confront him in Ramazith's Tower. Depending of whether players deceived Nightsong into marching in there without giving the whole context of how dangerous he is, the line will differ reacting to that.

AD_PuzzlePortalArmy.synopsis: One-liner AD given by the narrator describing the inscription on a plaque next to one of the portals in Sorcerous Sundries. In this one a false statement is said about the nightsong is given to mark this portal as a wrong one to go through in the Sorcerous Sundries portal puzzle.
AD_PuzzlePortalArmy.how_to_trigger: Interact with the plaque next to the purple portal in CTY_Main, 0; 30; -97

AD_LorroakanPostConfrontation.synopsis: One liner to show how Lorroakan is starting to cage Nightsong and why she is not reviving herself as usual.
AD_LorroakanPostConfrontation.how_to_trigger: Side lorroakan in the Ramazith's Tower confrontation after talking to Nightsong about the plot and having her go there.

AD_AradinReactEnterWhileYelling.synopsis: One liner for Aradin when the player goes inside Sorcerous Sundries shop while he is stopped by Klank, he will complain about this "injustice"
AD_AradinReactEnterWhileYelling.how_to_trigger: Go through the main gate at Sorcerous Sundries without interacting with Aradin or KlankLocation: CTY_Main_A  209; 24; 436

Client000.synopsis: One liner for a mother that has come to Sorcerous Sundries to get supplies

Client001.synopsis: One liner for a boy in Sorcerous Sundries next to two elementals.

Klank.synopsis: If Aradin is not present at the Sorcerous Sundries shop yelling at Klank, the player can inspect the automated armor to potentially learn more from it, although it does not speak.

PAD_NoCurseInTome.synopsis: One liner AD result of having interacted with one of the cursed tomes in Sorcerous Sundries while somebody else has the curse effect from that book, to make players know no effect was applied.
PAD_NoCurseInTome.how_to_trigger: Have a character interact with one of these (you can buy it from Tolna):S_LOW_SightOfTheSeelieS_LOW_CurriculumStrategyS_LOW_KarsusNotes, get the curse and then have another character read the same book.CTY_Main_A 8; 26; -93

Cal.synopsis: Dialog with Cal, who is now working at Sorcerous Sundries, following his brother Rolan, who is now an apprentice there. For her to be there, she needs to have been saved in Act 2.
Cal.how_to_trigger: Interact with Cal in Sorcerous Sundries.Location: CTY_Main_A 15; 26; -89

NightsongCampAttacked.synopsis: EDGE CASE: Player has attacked Aylin/ Isobel in camp.
NightsongCampAttacked.how_to_trigger: Recruit Isobel and NS.Attack them in camp

LorroakanProjection.synopsis: Projection dialog acting as Sorcerous Sundries' clerk in case of Rolan's death. They are basically the  an automated calling system with prerecorded messages. He also has the ability to cast a portal to take players to the real Lorroakan.
LorroakanProjection.how_to_trigger: Talk to Lorroakan's Projection in Sorcerous Sundries. He is only there if Rolan is dead.Location: BGO_Main_A: -1752; 26; 594

PuzzleGuardian.synopsis: Dialog with a Lorroakan projection in the puzzle location. The projection will give instructions about how to solve the portal puzzle.
PuzzleGuardian.how_to_trigger: Interact with the puzzle guardian in CTY_Main_A 8; 30; -92. He appears when entering the trigger in that area. 8; 30; -92.

PAD_ReactionToTomeRead.synopsis: PAD for when reading a rare magic tome from Tolna, the bookkeeper of Sorcerous Sundries. Each one of these will give a scroll with a powerful spell when first read, this PAD aknowledges that.
PAD_ReactionToTomeRead.how_to_trigger: In CTY_Main_A, call oe LOW_SorcerousSundries_GetTomesRead any book that's not Tharchiate Codex

AD_AradinSeesKlankAttacked.synopsis: AD one liner that Aradin says when players attack klank while he is yelling at it, making him to join the fight.
AD_AradinSeesKlankAttacked.how_to_trigger: Attack Klank at Sorcerous Sundries while Aradin is near it, yelling.Location: CTY_Main_A 209; 24; 436

LorroakanProjectionWarning.synopsis: Dialog in which Lorroakan's Projection, who is substituing Rolan while Lorroakan is still in Ramazith Tower, bars entry to a banned player.
LorroakanProjectionWarning.how_to_trigger: 1) call oe LOW_SorcerousSundries_AradinLeaveAndAttack in recon2)stealthly ctrl+shift+k Rolan in CTY_Main_A 205; 26; 5303) ctrl+shift+k Klank, who is at the entrance of the shop in front of Rolan4) try to walk inside the shop and get interrupted

AD_PuzzlePortalWealth.synopsis: One-liner AD given by the narrator describing the inscription on a plaque next to one of the portals in Sorcerous Sundries. In this one a false statement is said about the nightsong is given to mark this portal as a wrong one to go through in the Sorcerous Sundries portal puzzle.
AD_PuzzlePortalWealth.how_to_trigger: Interact with the plaque next to the orange portal in CTY_Main, 11; 30; -89

AD_NecromanticBuy.synopsis: An repeated AD conversation between a vendor in the necromantic area of the shop and a potential customer. When a player gets close the vendor resurrects a body in gameplay with Raise Dead and starts this dialog.

NightsongCamp.synopsis: The avatar talks to Nightsong in camp after meeting Lorroakan and seeing how he is looking for her. The player explains what he knows, which will trigger nightsong to leave to camp to confront Lorroakan.
NightsongCamp.how_to_trigger: 1- Recruit NS 3- Debugbook -> Set quest flags and options → Sorcerous Sundries -> Make Nightsong wait for dialog at camp2- Talk to nightsong in camp

PAD_MystraVaultEntered.synopsis: PAD players say when they reach mystra vault in Sorcerous Sundries basement. Depending on whether the karus book is being looked for in gale's quest and if players succeed on a passive check a different line will appear, giving or not a hint to how to leave the vault. The doors are each named after a famous wizard - Elminster, Ramazith, Silverhand and Karsus.
PAD_MystraVaultEntered.how_to_trigger: Reach 366; 0; 997 in CTY_Main_A, which will trigger the passive check and then the PAD

Client006.synopsis: One liner of a character looking at discarded books near the literature desk in Sorcerous Sundries. He reference both the variety and hint at the rare cursed tomes Tolna has.

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged.synopsis: Dialog with Isobel who is still waiting on Nightsong from going to Ramazith's tower. She is not coming back because Lorroakan soul caged her. Isobel will leave camp in bad terms to rescue her.
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged.how_to_trigger: Talk to Isobel in camp after having sided with Lorroakan in Ramazith's Tower confrontation 4970; 0; 704 (after having talked to Nightsong about the bounty on her)

RolanPortal_AD.synopsis: Rolan lets the players know they can reach Lorroakan through the portal he just conjured. He also tells them he will remain in the shop while they are going to see his idol, so he is a bit salty about it.
RolanPortal_AD.how_to_trigger: When asking Rolan in dialog to take the player's to Lorroakan and him going to the location where he casts a portal.Location: BGO_Main_A: 222; 16; 324

RolanConclusion.synopsis: Dialog after final confrontation with Rolan. Depending on whether he joined Nightsong team or not or if Lorroakan died or not different branches will be chosen.
RolanConclusion.how_to_trigger: 1- oe LOW_SorcerousSundries_NightsongGo2- Go to CTY_Main_A 4960; 0; 705 start dialogue 3- End combat after dialogue4- Talk to Rolan

NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight.synopsis: Dialog with Nightsong and Isobel in camp after defeating Lorroakan. They are both very happy
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight.how_to_trigger: 1:Recruit NS and Isobel2:oe LOW_SorcerousSundries_NightsongGo3: defeat Lorroakan in CTY_Main_A 4960; 0; 7054: long rest5: go to camp and talk to either NS or Isobel

AD_GaleSensesKarsusTome.synopsis: An AD one-liner that will show Gale feeling the presence of the Karsus netherese cursed tome, if he gets close to the rare book area and the book is near. This should prompt the player to get this book.
AD_GaleSensesKarsusTome.how_to_trigger: Enter the trigger S_LOW_KarsusTomeADGaleTrigger, at CTY_Main_A 8; 26; -92, with the Karsus tome in it.

AD_RolanReactLorroakanDeath.synopsis: One liner AD of Rolan after teleporting himself to Ramazith's Tower due to Lorroakan having been killed there.
AD_RolanReactLorroakanDeath.how_to_trigger: Kill lorroakan in CTY_Main_A 4960; 0; 705 and kill any subsequent combat. Rolan will appear by the teleporter and run to Lorroakan saying this line.

Aradin.synopsis: Aradin is yelling to Klank because it is blocking the entrance to the Sorcerous Sundries shop. Aradin asks the player whether they had success on the quest of the nightsong and leaves.LORR-oh-AH-kan.
Aradin.how_to_trigger: Talk to aradin in fron of Sorcerous Sundries.209; 24; 436There are two main elements to set before starting sorcerous sundries: set whether Nightsong is alive at camp or dead and add her to camp if she is alive.Debug Book → Set quest flags and options → Sorcerous Sundries → Make Nightsong be dead / Make Nightsong be at campTo physically add Nightsong to camp we have to execute Camp Debug Book → Invite People → Invite individuals → Invite NIGHTSONGYou can advance the plot by setting “Make Nightsong wait for dialog at camp” (will have to be at camp first) and “Make Nightsong go final confrontation. Both options are at Debug Book → Set quest flags and options → Sorcerous Sundries →

AD_MomAndSonNearElemental.synopsis: Short dialog between a child and his mom, who have come in the Sorcerous Sundries shop, presumably to buy something. The kid is looking at the enourmous lava elemental near it."Mumbus" is the kid's name for his mom, pronounced how it looks (mum-bus)
AD_MomAndSonNearElemental.how_to_trigger: Go near the two humanoid NPCs in CTY_Main -2; 26; -73

Lorroakan_Dead.synopsis: Speak with Dead dialog with Lorroakan. He will give some information on his backstory, relationship
Lorroakan_Dead.how_to_trigger: 1: Kill Lorroakan2: Cast speak with dead on his corpseLocation: CTY_Main_A 697; 0; 703

AD_PuzzlePortalImmortality.synopsis: One-liner AD given by the narrator describing the inscription on a plaque next to one of the portals in Sorcerous Sundries. In this one a true statement is said about the nightsong is given to mark this portal as the right one to go through in the Sorcerous Sundries portal puzzle. This statement should be understood only y someone that knows about the true aasimar Nightsong.
AD_PuzzlePortalImmortality.how_to_trigger: Interact with the plaque next to the blue portal in CTY_Main, 13; 30; -82

AnimatedArmor.synopsis: One liner for the animated armors that are inside Sorcerous Sundries (other than Klank). It should also take into account that this dialog can fire while the animated armor is unconcious due to having cast Dispel Magic.
AnimatedArmor.how_to_trigger: Talk to one of the animated armors other than Klank in Sorcerous Sundries. CTY_Main_A  -17; 26; -88

RolanProjectionWarning.synopsis: Dialog in which Rolan's Projection, who is substituing Rolan after Lorroakan is dead. The projection bars entry to the Sorcerous Sundries shop to a banned player.
RolanProjectionWarning.how_to_trigger: 1) kill Lorroakan at  CTY_Main_A 4960; 0; 7052) Kill Rolan when he appears at the scene3) Go through any portal that is not the left one on the second floor of Ramazith at -1; 30; -97 (and revive yourself)4) call oe LOW_SorcerousSundries_AradinLeaveAndAttack in recon5)  ctrl+shift+k Klank at -15; 26; -686) attempt to enter the shop, getting interrupted

Client007.synopsis: One liner for an alarmed customer constantly moving around the shop.
Client007.how_to_trigger: Talk to S_LOW_Client_007, will be moving around the shop. (CTY_Main_A aprox -16; 26; -84)

PAD_ReactionToTharchiateCodex.synopsis: PAD for when reading the Tharchiate Codex, a necromantic book that applies a curse which reduces CON stats (which can be removed to get a positive boost)  but also will allow players to read the last page of Necromancy of Thay. If players have managed to read
PAD_ReactionToTharchiateCodex.how_to_trigger: In CTY_Main_A, call oe LOW_SorcerousSundries_GetTomesRead Tharchiate Codex

Lia.synopsis: Dialog with Lia, who is now working at Sorcerous Sundries, following his brother Rolan, who is now an apprentice there. For her to be there, she needs to have been saved in Act 2.
Lia.how_to_trigger: Interact with Lia in Sorcerous Sundries.Location: CTY_Main_A -15; 26; -80

Client004.synopsis: One liner of a client in Sorcerous Sundries explaining how the Absolute threat has affected people.

PAD_LorroakanImmortal.synopsis: PAD onliner that triggers when players reach Ramazith's tower after Lorroakan has become immortal by imprisoning Nightsong. A comment can be made either commenting on Lorroakan's power or the betrayal of a key ally.

CursedTomeKarsus.synopsis: Dialog after reading the Karsus book while being Gale that will allow the player to realize that the crown of Karsus is the device that was on the Netherbrain.
CursedTomeKarsus.how_to_trigger: Be Gale, then read LOW_KarsusNotes (can be bought from Tolna by asking about rare tomes in Sorcerous Sundries or stolen at (CTY_Main_A 8; 26; -93)

PAD_NightsongLeftAfterBetrayal.synopsis: PAD onliner that triggers when players get near the body of rolan after players side with lorroakan -> he dies -> rolan becomes master -> long rest -> Nightsong gets free.
PAD_NightsongLeftAfterBetrayal.how_to_trigger: 1 - Go next to the blue teleporter in CTY_Main_A 13; 30; -822 - DebugBook -> quest flags -> Act3 -> LOW - Sorcerous Sundries -> Make Nightsong go final confrontation3 - Go through the teleporter4 - Side with lorroakan and start fight5 - Make sure Lorroakan dies and Rolan lives through the combat6 - Long rest and go back to ramazith, get close to Rolan's body

LorroakanConclusion.synopsis: Lorroakan's dialoge after winning the fight against Nightsong. In gameplay he will attempt to fit her into the soul cage device (after this dialogue-- this should remain bronze).

AD_PuzzlePortalPotion.synopsis: One-liner AD given by the narrator describing the inscription on a plaque next to one of the portals in Sorcerous Sundries. In this one a false statement is said about the nightsong is given to mark this portal as a wrong one to go through in the Sorcerous Sundries portal puzzle.
AD_PuzzlePortalPotion.how_to_trigger: Interact with the plaque next to the green portal in CTY_Main, 5; 30; -95

Tolna.synopsis: Dialog between the player and Tolna. Tolna is responsible for everything book-related in the Sorcerous Sundries shop. Players can ask her about the high-end books, including the Carenthian cypher, which allows the player to read the last chapter of the Necromancy of Thay book. Players can pay a large sum for them.Tolna only speaks in whispers
Tolna.how_to_trigger: Talk to Tolna in Sorcerous Sundries shop.Location: BGO_Main_A, -1765; 26; 594

NightsongConclusion.synopsis: When Lorroakan is on 0 HP and combat stops, Nightsong approaches Lorroakan's body, picks it up, uses a backbreaker on him (killing him), then talks to the player.
NightsongConclusion.how_to_trigger: Triggers automatically after combat.Location aprox: BGO_Main_A -756; 0; -1099

AD_ClientReading.synopsis: One liner of a character looking at the literature section of Sorcerous Sundries

TolnaReactTomesStealAttempt.synopsis: One liner for when players try to open the display cases where the rare books are. If a player repeatedly tries to get them, the librarian Tolna will be more and more agitated, ending up yelling, which will cause some furniture to explode. Further attempts will make faction hostile.
TolnaReactTomesStealAttempt.how_to_trigger: Interact with the display cases at CTY_Main_A 7; 26; -91

NightsongPostAttack.synopsis: Nightsong's dialogue after Aradin attacks the Camp and is repelled.
NightsongPostAttack.how_to_trigger: 1- Recruit NS2-  Debugbook -> Set quest flags and options → Sorcerous Sundries -> Make Aradin go away (will attack camp)3- Long rest and fight Aradin when he shows up in camp4- After all enemies dead NS will come to player and start dialogue

Rolan.synopsis: Dialog with Sorcerous Sundries' clerk Rolan. He will explain how Lorroakan is neglecting him in his search for the Nightsong. Player can ask Rolan to make a portal to Lorroakan.
Rolan.how_to_trigger: Interact with Rolan in Sorcerous Sundries. Location aprox: -1730; 26; 592

AD_GuardianWrongPortal.synopsis: One liner AD that a Lorroakan Projection says when a player has entered a wrong portal at Sorcerous Sundries and therefore got deleported and killed. He will basically mock and/or chastise the player for attempting to reach him.
AD_GuardianWrongPortal.how_to_trigger: Interact with a portal that is not the blue one in CTY_Main_A 8; 30; -92

WaterElemental.synopsis: One liner dialog when interacting with the Water Elemental at sorcerous sundries.
WaterElemental.how_to_trigger: Interact with water elemental at CTY_Main_A -6; 26; -69

FireElemental.synopsis: One liner for when interacting with the elementals in Sorcerous Sundries
FireElemental.how_to_trigger: Talk to the elementals in CTY_Main_A -5; 26; -71

PAD_ExploringVault.synopsis: PAD onliner that triggers when players enter the lower area of Ramazith's Tower, where there is a puzzle/exploring/trapped area with cool loot. Some lore can be given about the tower in general or focus on the exploring action.

FinalConfrontation.synopsis: Nightsong's confrontation with Lorroakan in his tower, once the player tells Nightsong (or she finds out) that Lorroakan is looking for her.
FinalConfrontation.how_to_trigger: 1 - Go next to the blue teleporter in CTY_Main_A 13; 30; -822 - DebugBook -> quest flags -> Act3 -> LOW - Sorcerous Sundries -> Make Nightsong go final confrontation3 - Go through the teleporter

AD_RolanWithoutLorroakanAfterCombat.synopsis: AD oneliner for Rolan after combat in Ramazith's Tower where players sided with Lorroakan, then he died and Nightsong died too. Rolan is to become master of the Tower after his master died.
AD_RolanWithoutLorroakanAfterCombat.how_to_trigger: 1 - Go next to the blue teleporter in CTY_Main_A 13; 30; -822 - DebugBook -> quest flags -> Act3 -> LOW - Sorcerous Sundries -> Make Nightsong go final confrontation3 - Go through the teleporter4 - End dialog and start fight5 - Make sure Lorroakan dies and Rolan lives through the combat

Client005.synopsis: One liner for a client in Sorcerous Sundries, asking where the manager is.
Client005.how_to_trigger: Talk to S_LOW_Client_005  in Sorcerous Sundries (CTY_Main_A -15; 26; -81)

AD_RamazithTowerNoGale.synopsis: A prompt to get Gale and bring him here since he has story progression in Sorcerous Sundries.This dialogue will play in Sundries rather than Ramazith's Tower.
AD_RamazithTowerNoGale.how_to_trigger: Go up the stairs in Sorcerous Sundries to enter trigger placed at CTY_Main_A  0; 28; -83

AD_AradinYellingAtKlank.synopsis: Aradin yelling at Klank, furious about being kicked out from Lorroakan's shop and how his contract got Aradin's friends killed.

AD_CoupleBuying.synopsis: AD dialog where couple of civilians are stress-buying in Sorcerous Sundries due to all the chaos in BG

AD_WakeOfTheDeadReaction.synopsis: One liner civilians will say after players cast Wake of the Dead, a spell that summons uncontrollable zombies around the player. These zombies will be hostile to everything. The casting of this spell will make civilians/guards hostile to the player.
AD_WakeOfTheDeadReaction.how_to_trigger: oe LOW_SorcerousSundries_ZombieSpell to get the spell, then cast it near civilians.(note: the crime implementation of this spell is still not done, so this AD is not going to trigger for now)

PAD_AlarmPerceptionSucceeded.synopsis: One line AD result of having succeeded the passive perception check on an item warded by the Alarm spell.
PAD_AlarmPerceptionSucceeded.how_to_trigger: Get close to an item such as the warded quartestaff in CTY_Main_A 709; -21; 707 and succeed investigation roll.

Client002.synopsis: One liner from a customer in Sorcerous Sundries

PAD_BoughtKarsusBook.synopsis: PAD for when players acquire the Netherese book from Tolna, either from buying it or stealing it. It will trigger if Gale didnt express the interest in the book in the Tolna dialog (meaning he was far enough to not be in the inclusion). Players will note that would be interesting to show it to him. Alternatively, if the book was gotten by Gale himself as avatar, the hint will point towards reading it to trigger the AOM.
PAD_BoughtKarsusBook.how_to_trigger: 1) Go to CTY_Main_A 8; 26; -93 with only one avatar (in order no to trigger a dialog between an avatar and gale companion when leaving dialog)2) Buy The Annals of Karsus: A Netherese Folly from her3) Leave the dialog, which will trigger the PAD

IsobelCamp.synopsis: Camp dialog with Isobel in which she expresses her frustration and anxiety while waiting for nightsong after she left to kill Lorroakan.
IsobelCamp.how_to_trigger: 1: Camp debugbook -> recruit Isobel2:oe LOW_SorcerousSundries_NightsongGo3: Talk to Isobel in camp

AD_LorroakanProjectionPuzzle.synopsis: AD one-liner from the puzzle guardian, a spell projection that will appear when players get near the portals that lead to Ramazith's tower. This line should show that Lorroakan wil only allow people that know who NS is.

RolanWarning.synopsis: Warning from Rolan to the player, who is blacklisted. He will give the chance to either run leave the shop or have combat
RolanWarning.how_to_trigger: Debugbook->Set quest flags and options → Sorcerous Sundries-> Toggle/Untoggle blacklist in shop for this characterTeleport to CTY_Main_A -9; 26; -74

RolanProjection.synopsis: Dialog with Rolan's projection at Sorcerous Sundries shop, which now acts as clerk if Rolan is master of Ramazith's Tow
RolanProjection.how_to_trigger: 1- oe LOW_SorcerousSundries_MakeRolanInCharge2- Talk to Rolan's Projection in CTY_Main_A -4; 26; -80

NecromancerVendor.synopsis: One liner for the necromancer working in Sorcerours Sundries. He just revived a corpse to show the effect of his wares to a customer.
NecromancerVendor.how_to_trigger: Talk to the necromancer in CTY_Main_A 14; 26; -77

Lorroakan.synopsis: Lorroakan's initial dialog with the player in Ramazith's tower, where he plans to have Nightsong imprisoned like Ketheric had. He will ask the player to deliver her to him.
Lorroakan.how_to_trigger: Use debug book to teleport to Act 3 - > LOW - > Sorcerous Sundries --> Ramazith's TowerTemporary location: BGO_Main_A: -1769; 26; 599

Client003.synopsis: One liner of a client in Sorcerous Sundries who is panic-buying.

AD_ClientsDiscussion.synopsis: Discussion with two customers in Sorrcerous Sundries showing the state of panic-buying in the city and also hinting at the puzzle to reach Ramazith's Tower.
AD_ClientsDiscussion.how_to_trigger: Enter the S_LOW_ClientsDiscussionTrigger to trigger it. (CTY_Main_A -14; 26; -82)

ZombieNecromancy.synopsis: One liner for the zombie that was just raised by a necromancer vendor in Sorcerous Sundries.
ZombieNecromancy.how_to_trigger: Get close to CTY_Main_A 14; 26; -77 and talk to the zombie that gets raised.

AD_NightsongCallsLorroakan_0.speaker: Nightsong
AD_NightsongCallsLorroakan_0.text: Aha! I spy a wizard foul.

NightsongCaged_0.speaker: Narrator
NightsongCaged_0.text: *Dame Aylin will not meet your gaze.*

NightsongCaged_1.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCaged_1.text: ISOBEL! ISOBEL! Why did you bring her here?! What have you done?!
NightsongCaged_1.context: NodeContext: She's just watched the love of her life (Isobel) be killed in front of her. This is true agony, from the depths of her soul.

NightsongCaged_10.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCaged_10.text: WHEN I AM FREE, I WILL DESTROY YOU! I WILL MURDER YOU, AND YOUR CHILDREN, AND THEIR CHILDREN BESIDE!
NightsongCaged_10.context: NodeContext: She's just watched the love of her life (Isobel) be killed in front of her. This is true agony, from the depths of her soul.

NightsongCaged_6.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCaged_6.text: I will rip this world apart, plank and beam, until every iota of your being is scalded by my light. This is my promise. This is my vow.
NightsongCaged_6.context: NodeContext: She's just watched the love of her life (Isobel) be killed in front of her. This is true agony, from the depths of her soul.

NightsongCaged_2.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCaged_2.text: Do not tell Isobel what fate has befallen Dame Aylin. She must not enter this viper's den.
NightsongCaged_2.context: NodeContext: Staring at the ground. Full of disappointment, deep pain, hatred, but steadying herself.

NightsongCaged_8.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCaged_8.text: You stood to gain from my undoing. I know your reasons, fetid though they are. But Isobel...
NightsongCaged_8.context: NodeContext: Staring at the ground. Full of disappointment, deep pain, hatred, but steadying herself.

NightsongCaged_9.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCaged_9.text: ...Isobel deserves to live. Please - do not harm a hair on her blessèd head.
NightsongCaged_9.context: NodeContext: Looks up at the player, staring in their eyes

NightsongCaged_5.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCaged_5.text: May the Moonmaiden have mercy on your soul.

NightsongCaged_3.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCaged_3.text: I am sorry for you. You who have no honour. You who have no pride.
NightsongCaged_3.context: NodeContext: Staring directly at the player, full of defiance, hatred

NightsongCaged_4.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCaged_4.text: When next we meet, no words will cross Dame Aylin's lips, but her sword will find your flesh and make of it her sheath.
NightsongCaged_4.context: NodeContext: Staring directly at the player, full of defiance, hatred

NightsongCaged_7.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCaged_7.text: May the Moonmaiden have mercy on your soul.
NightsongCaged_7.context: NodeContext: Staring directly at the player, full of defiance, hatred

NecromancyBuyer_0.speaker: Alice Althea
NecromancyBuyer_0.text: Do you think that zombie looks... fresh? Is fresh good? I never know with zombies...

NecromancyBuyer_1.speaker: Alice Althea
NecromancyBuyer_1.text: Quiet, please - I'm trying to decide if shelling out for one of these things is worth it.

PAD_NightsongGoesToRamazith_1.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongGoesToRamazith_1.text: And just like that, she's off to walk into Lorroakan's trap.

AD_PuzzlePortalArmy_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_PuzzlePortalArmy_0.text: *The Nightsong is a druidic staff that allows its bearer command over an army of ancient beasts.*

AD_AradinReactEnterWhileYelling_0.speaker: Aradin
AD_AradinReactEnterWhileYelling_0.text: Don't spend your gold in there, mate. Bastard wizard don't deserve it.

Client000_0.speaker: Thalita Cross
Client000_0.text: Have you seen how much the prices have risen? Might as well be throwing my gold straight into the lava elemental!

Client000_1.speaker: Thalita Cross
Client000_1.text: I'm so grateful the shops are staying open despite everything, but it's all so very dear.

Client001_0.speaker: Heder Cross
Client001_0.text: I want a pet elemental, but mumbus says I'm not old enough. I wouldn't let it die like the goldfish, though!

Client001_1.speaker: Heder Cross
Client001_1.text: You look like you could drink an entire water elemental in one go!

Klank_8.speaker: Klank
Klank_8.context: NodeContext: Sound of air flowing through metal helmet. A neutral greeting.

Klank_6.speaker: Klank
Klank_6.context: NodeContext: Sound of air flowing through metal helmet. A neutral greeting.

Klank_1.speaker: Klank
Klank_1.context: NodeContext: Sound of air flowing through metal helmet. A neutral greeting.

Klank_0.speaker: Player
Klank_0.text: Examine the armour to discern its nature.

Klank_11.speaker: Narrator
Klank_11.text: *This armour is a construct animated by powerful magic. It has no soul or power of speech, but it follows the directives of its master.*

Klank_2.speaker: Narrator
Klank_2.text: *It feels no pain and knows no morality; it will act on behalf of its master and perish when the magic that binds it is severed.*

Klank_12.speaker: Narrator
Klank_12.text: *Whatever magic powers the armour is beyond your knowledge.*

Klank_10.speaker: Klank
Klank_10.context: NodeContext: Sound of air flowing through metal helmet. A neutral greeting.

PAD_NoCurseInTome_0.speaker: Player
PAD_NoCurseInTome_0.text: No effect. For the best, I think.

Cal_1.speaker: Cal
Cal_1.text: I'm half afraid to touch anything in case I break it. Which I have done - twice.

Cal_2.speaker: Cal
Cal_2.text: If only Lia could see how far we've come - she'd be so proud.

Cal_3.speaker: Cal
Cal_3.text: Have you seen this place? It's incredible! And this is our house now?
Cal_3.context: NodeContext: excited - like a big kid

Cal_0.speaker: Cal
Cal_0.text: Think it goes without saying that you have a room here - any time.

NightsongCampAttacked_2.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCampAttacked_2.text: You defile our alliance with violence. A disappointment - but not a threat to Dame Aylin, immortal.

NightsongCampAttacked_1.speaker: Isobel
NightsongCampAttacked_1.text: We should never have come here. You should never have feigned our friendship. A decision you'll soon regret.

LorroakanProjection_0.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_0.text: All services suspended until the current threat in Ramazith's Tower is neutralised. Have a magical day!

LorroakanProjection_8.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_8.text: Welcome, dear patron, to Sorcerous Sundries.

LorroakanProjection_58.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_58.text: It has come to my attention that there is a BITTER ADVENTURER located OUTSIDE the shop! Not to worry. We will quickly handle this disturbance for your comfort and safety.
LorroakanProjection_58.context: NodeContext: Like an answering machine for a chain business or automated customer service bot where the words in all caps were added into the sentence separately

LorroakanProjection_28.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_28.text: I am an un-person in service of the revered wizard Lorroakan, proprietor of this fine establishment.

LorroakanProjection_3.speaker: Narrator
LorroakanProjection_3.text: *Lorroakan's illusion is blissfully unaware of its caster's demise, but remains bound to its duties.*

LorroakanProjection_12.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_12.text: To browse our wares, say 'TRADE'. To provide information about the Nightsong, say 'NIGHTSONG'.

LorroakanProjection_51.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_51.text: If you are a city official here to collect dues, say 'TAXES'. For all other inquiries, say 'OTHER'.

LorroakanProjection_67.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_67.text: The provision of information that leads to the retrieval of the Nightsong is worth a great deal to Master Lorroakan. Do you have information regarding the Nightsong?

LorroakanProjection_54.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_54.text: Please proceed upstairs for further instructions.

LorroakanProjection_29.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_29.text: Thank you! Please come again soon, and have a magical day!

LorroakanProjection_45.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_45.text: Line of inquiry terminated. How else might I be of assistance?

LorroakanProjection_61.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_61.text: This establishment's dues have been paid in full. See you soon, Mister Marvin Hudd.

LorroakanProjection_14.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_14.text: Your request has been previously denied due to INCORRECT FACE.

LorroakanProjection_35.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_35.text: Tax money has already been allotted for your personal use.

LorroakanProjection_68.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_68.text: Your request has been previously denied due to POOR REASONING.

LorroakanProjection_23.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_23.text: Tax money has already been donated for the purpose of this projection's self-preservation.

LorroakanProjection_11.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_11.text: Your request has been previously denied due to INSUFFICIENT INTIMIDATION.

LorroakanProjection_41.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_41.text: You are not Mister Marvin Hudd, the collections officer assigned to this establishment.

LorroakanProjection_40.speaker: Player
LorroakanProjection_40.text: Looks like I have the wrong building. My apologies.

LorroakanProjection_6.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_6.text: How else can I help you today?

LorroakanProjection_46.speaker: Player
LorroakanProjection_46.text: Trust me, your taxes will be put to better use in my hands.

LorroakanProjection_56.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Projection hands off cash below screen.

LorroakanProjection_18.speaker: Player
LorroakanProjection_18.text: Don't you recognise Marvin Hudd when you see him?

LorroakanProjection_34.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_34.text: Forgive this error in my analysis. Hello Mister Marvin Hudd. Please find your payment in full.
LorroakanProjection_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Projection hands off cash below screen.

LorroakanProjection_71.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_71.text: Until next we meet! Is there anything else I can help you with?

LorroakanProjection_7.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_7.text: False. Please do not attempt to lie to Master Lorroakan's projection.
LorroakanProjection_7.context: NodeContext: Could be funny to do 'Master Lorroakan' and then '-'s projection' almost as an aisde

LorroakanProjection_44.speaker: Player
LorroakanProjection_44.text: Fork over what you owe, or I'll crush your head.

LorroakanProjection_27.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Projection hands off cash below screen.

LorroakanProjection_15.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_15.text: To learn more about the search for the Nightsong, say 'NIGHTSONG'. To learn more about Master Lorroakan, say 'LORROAKAN'. To learn more about my good self, say 'PROJECTION'.

LorroakanProjection_31.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_31.text: The Nightsong is a relic hidden in an underground temple beneath a settlement near the river Chionthar.

LorroakanProjection_53.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_53.text: Master Lorroakan is offering a considerable sum for the object's retrieval.

LorroakanProjection_33.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_33.text: To truly know Master Lorroakan is the work of a lifetime. Suffice it to say he is a powerful, important man whose powers exceed the limitations by which most wizards are constrained.

LorroakanProjection_42.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_42.text: He resides in Ramazith's Tower. Anyone bearing information leading to the capture of the Nightsong may gain an audience with him.

LorroakanProjection_43.speaker: Gale
LorroakanProjection_43.text: The great and powerful Lorroakan, offering our humble group an audience? We are honoured.
LorroakanProjection_43.context: NodeContext: Dripping with sarcasm - Gale doesn't think much of Lorroakan

LorroakanProjection_70.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_70.text: I am the product of an ingenious bit of magic performed by Master Lorroakan. I am blessed with sufficient intelligence to adequately run and protect this shop, Sorcerous Sundries.

LorroakanProjection_16.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_16.text: Because Master Lorroakan is engaged in important work, I take care of such banalities as speaking with customers.

LorroakanProjection_32.speaker: Player
LorroakanProjection_32.text: Hold on - you said you're an un-person? What's that?

LorroakanProjection_49.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_49.text: I'm sorry. I didn't understand your query.

LorroakanProjection_47.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjection_47.text: Welcome back to Sorcerous Sundries! How can I help you?

PuzzleGuardian_1.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
PuzzleGuardian_1.text: Welcome, dear patron, to the floor at the top of the stairs.

PuzzleGuardian_2.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
PuzzleGuardian_2.text: If you have information about the NIGHTSONG, great riches await. If you are here to waste the great wizard Lorroakan's time, reconsider.

PuzzleGuardian_3.speaker: Narrator
PuzzleGuardian_3.text: *You recognise this image projection spell from your studies - though you'd expect a great wizard to execute it less shoddily.*

PuzzleGuardian_0.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
PuzzleGuardian_0.text: Let your knowledge determine your path forward.
PuzzleGuardian_0.context: NodeContext: Cheerfully neutral, like data from Star Trek

PuzzleGuardian_4.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
PuzzleGuardian_4.text: Welcome back, dear patron. Remember that the great wizard doesn't suffer fools who waste his time.

PAD_ReactionToTomeRead_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ReactionToTomeRead_0.text: Quite some valuable knowledge hidden between these pages.

AD_AradinSeesKlankAttacked_0.speaker: Aradin
AD_AradinSeesKlankAttacked_0.text: All right! Time that old bucket got his due.

LorroakanProjectionWarning_0.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjectionWarning_0.text: I'm sorry, but you have been banned from these premises due to HABITUAL VIOLENCE.
LorroakanProjectionWarning_0.context: NodeContext: All-caps text should be read like a call center answering machine with fill-in-the-blanks

LorroakanProjectionWarning_5.speaker: Player
LorroakanProjectionWarning_5.text: You ought to get out of my way, unless you want me to habitually murder you, too.

LorroakanProjectionWarning_4.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjectionWarning_4.text: I am not alive and cannot be killed. Unlike your unfortunate self. Good-bye and thank you for shopping at Sorcerous Sundries!

LorroakanProjectionWarning_2.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
LorroakanProjectionWarning_2.text: Sorcerous Sundries would like to remind you that interfering with its personnel - enchanted or otherwise - is a bannable offence. Take this as your first and final warning.

AD_PuzzlePortalWealth_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_PuzzlePortalWealth_0.text: *The Nightsong is a priceless ruby from a realm beyond our own.*

AD_NecromanticBuy_3.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
AD_NecromanticBuy_3.text: I can tell you're a discerning customer - you're after nothing but the best.

AD_NecromanticBuy_22.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
AD_NecromanticBuy_22.text: And luckily for you, that's exactly what I have - the best necromantic charms in the city or your money back!

AD_NecromanticBuy_8.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
AD_NecromanticBuy_8.text: Just think of the possibilities once you have a fresh, high-quality, completely safe zombie at your disposal.
AD_NecromanticBuy_8.context: NodeContext: Confident salesman patter - keen to emphasise how safe the zombie definitely i

AD_NecromanticBuy_5.speaker: Alice Althea
AD_NecromanticBuy_5.text: Gods, but it stinks! And it looks like somebody melted most of its flesh off.

AD_NecromanticBuy_13.speaker: Alice Althea
AD_NecromanticBuy_13.text: I'd be a laughing stock with that lumbering 'round after me.

AD_NecromanticBuy_11.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
AD_NecromanticBuy_11.text: Now, now - you and I both know that being undead takes a toll on a corpse.

AD_NecromanticBuy_18.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
AD_NecromanticBuy_18.text: We also do a range of fetching liveries and complimentary perfume spritzers - all seasonal, of course.
AD_NecromanticBuy_18.context: NodeContext: Confident salesman patter; keen to emphasise how good of a deal this is

AD_NecromanticBuy_12.speaker: Alice Althea
AD_NecromanticBuy_12.text: So what can it do? I've a lot of domestic tasks that are quite frankly beneath me.
AD_NecromanticBuy_12.context: NodeContext: Contemplatively; haughty at the idea of doing said tasks herself

AD_NecromanticBuy_10.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
AD_NecromanticBuy_10.text: Oh. they excel at all those humdrum menial chores.

AD_NecromanticBuy_2.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
AD_NecromanticBuy_2.text: They're particularly good at cleaning - especially food disposal.

AD_NecromanticBuy_29.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
AD_NecromanticBuy_29.text: They'll happily eat anything you put in front of them.
AD_NecromanticBuy_29.context: NodeContext: Confident salesman patter; definitely not acknowledging the sinister undertone here

AD_NecromanticBuy_23.speaker: Alice Althea
AD_NecromanticBuy_23.text: It is rather a pain to clean up after dinner parties...

AD_NecromanticBuy_6.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
AD_NecromanticBuy_6.text: Word of warning, mind: make sure you empty them frequently.
AD_NecromanticBuy_6.context: NodeContext: Trying to stay cheerful/keep salesmanly attitude going despite what he's having to say

AD_NecromanticBuy_0.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
AD_NecromanticBuy_0.text: Otherwise you might have a gut explosion on your hands.
AD_NecromanticBuy_0.context: NodeContext: Trying to stay cheerful/keep salesmanly attitude going despite what he's having to say

AD_NecromanticBuy_19.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
AD_NecromanticBuy_19.context: NodeContext: Trying to stay cheerful/keep salesmanly attitude going despite what he's having to say

AD_NecromanticBuy_24.speaker: Alice Althea
AD_NecromanticBuy_24.text: Empty them? How? Oh. You know what - I'm not sure I want to know.
AD_NecromanticBuy_24.context: NodeContext: Slightly disgusted the more she thinks about it

AD_NecromanticBuy_14.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
AD_NecromanticBuy_14.text: One more thing: I recommend getting at least a couple of scrolls of Turn Undead just in case.
AD_NecromanticBuy_14.context: NodeContext: Trying to stay cheerful/keep salesmanly attitude going despite what he's saying

AD_NecromanticBuy_31.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
AD_NecromanticBuy_31.text: Just in case you happen to lose control of your shiny new servant.
AD_NecromanticBuy_31.context: NodeContext: Trying to stay cheerful/keep salesmanly attitude going despite what he's having to say

AD_NecromanticBuy_21.speaker: Alice Althea
AD_NecromanticBuy_21.text: Oh. Does that happen very often?

AD_NecromanticBuy_16.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
AD_NecromanticBuy_16.context: NodeContext: Trying to stay cheerful/keep salesmanly attitude going despite what he's having to say

AD_NecromanticBuy_4.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
AD_NecromanticBuy_4.text: It's very much a case of summoner error when it does - not our spellwork.
AD_NecromanticBuy_4.context: NodeContext: Trying to stay cheerful/keep salesmanly attitude going despite what he's having to say

AD_NecromanticBuy_1.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
AD_NecromanticBuy_1.text: Tell you what, I'll throw one in for free with your purchase - limited time offer.

AD_NecromanticBuy_25.speaker: Alice Althea
AD_NecromanticBuy_25.context: NodeContext: Kind of against buying one of these zombies now

AD_NecromanticBuy_15.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
AD_NecromanticBuy_15.text: They also make excellent low-cost bodyguards - and you can't be too careful with the way things are going.

AD_NecromanticBuy_7.speaker: Alice Althea
AD_NecromanticBuy_7.text: It looks a little fragile to me...

AD_NecromanticBuy_20.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
AD_NecromanticBuy_20.text: Nonsense! They're tougher than they look. Plus, even if they lose a limb, they keep on going.

AD_NecromanticBuy_27.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
AD_NecromanticBuy_27.text: I sold one to a wonderful old gent for property protection.

AD_NecromanticBuy_30.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
AD_NecromanticBuy_30.text: A trespasser chopped its arms off but it still chewed right through their ankles.

AD_NecromanticBuy_17.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
AD_NecromanticBuy_17.text: They won't be trespassing anywhere else in a hurry! Or walking at all, for that matter.
AD_NecromanticBuy_17.context: NodeContext: Confident salesman patter; definitely not acknowledging the sinister undertone here

NightsongCamp_60.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_60.text: Mother's Milk - your visage speaks of ill tidings. Speak, ally mine: what troubles you?

NightsongCamp_3.speaker: Player
NightsongCamp_3.text: A wizard called Lorroakan is looking for you.

NightsongCamp_23.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_23.text: Is he indeed? Pray tell, what does he seek from Dame Aylin?

NightsongCamp_41.speaker: Player
NightsongCamp_41.text: I think he just wants to talk. We should go find out what he wants.

NightsongCamp_51.speaker: Isobel
NightsongCamp_51.text: Aylin, I'm not sure about this. Something doesn't feel right.

NightsongCamp_37.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_37.text: Your intuitions are my lodestar, darling. But consider: now that Dame Aylin has returned to the fold of time, she could use allies and interlocutors.

NightsongCamp_10.speaker: Isobel
NightsongCamp_10.text: I'll come with you, then. Just in case.

NightsongCamp_43.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_43.text: My darling, we agreed you'd scout for the nearest Selûnite enclave this very night. Let us divide our efforts, all the sooner to be reunited.

NightsongCamp_30.speaker: Isobel
NightsongCamp_30.text: I won't let you go alone. Who knows what this wizard might have planned?

NightsongCamp_16.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_16.text: Our closest ally will accompany me - won't you? It will be a swift and fruitful chore.

NightsongCamp_2.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_2.text: Hmm. If you judge him worth the endeavour, then I will do as you say. Now that Dame Aylin has returned to the fold of time, she will need allies and interlocutors.

NightsongCamp_33.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_33.text: Hie we to this 'Lorroakan' right away. I am as eager to meet him as he is to ensnare me.

NightsongCamp_19.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_19.text: Do not speak false to Dame Aylin. Not after all we have endured.

NightsongCamp_53.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_53.text: I must face the villain, nose-to-nose and sword-to-sword. I hope I can count on your aid in the fight to come.

NightsongCamp_0.speaker: Isobel
NightsongCamp_0.text: You can't go alone. I'm coming too.

NightsongCamp_21.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_21.text: Dame Aylin will make short work of this wizard - whatever his intentions.

NightsongCamp_13.speaker: Player
NightsongCamp_13.text: He wants to cage you like Ketheric did.

NightsongCamp_46.speaker: Isobel
NightsongCamp_46.context: NodeContext: spits it out with disgust

NightsongCamp_44.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_44.text: Oh, I hope he tries. Please, Lorroakan, come to me with your magicks and your flaccid charms. Attempt to lay one hairy finger upon Dame Aylin, daughter of Selûne most high.
NightsongCamp_44.context: NodeContext: Low fury, daring Lorroakan to try to capture and cage her.

NightsongCamp_38.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_38.text: I will wring his neck until he's dead.

NightsongCamp_55.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_55.text: Ho! His end will be one more strand in the great braid of our friendship.

NightsongCamp_45.speaker: Isobel
NightsongCamp_45.text: I'm coming with you. I'd like to get a few licks in myself.

NightsongCamp_29.speaker: Player
NightsongCamp_29.text: I deceived him into thinking you're dead.

NightsongCamp_6.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_6.text: The weasel out-weasled. Well done, my friend.

NightsongCamp_42.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_42.text: But Dame Aylin's deeds are great; her presence - present. Sooner or later, he will discover that the daughter of Selûne lives.

NightsongCamp_4.speaker: Player
NightsongCamp_4.text: Don't pursue him, Aylin. He's dangerous.

NightsongCamp_34.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_34.text: It is he who must not pursue me.

NightsongCamp_24.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_24.text: Let us travel to his chambers, his lair. We will see him undone in the style of the dead, unburied Ketheric Thorm.

NightsongCamp_52.speaker: Player
NightsongCamp_52.text: Don't pursue him, Aylin. He could be dangerous.

NightsongCamp_17.speaker: Player
NightsongCamp_17.text: All I know is that he's put out a contract for your capture.

NightsongCamp_26.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_26.text: Magicians and their machinations. I have had enough for an eternity.

NightsongCamp_47.speaker: Player
NightsongCamp_47.text: He seemed a braggart and a fool - I wouldn't worry about it.

NightsongCamp_11.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_11.text: Dame Aylin does not worry; she strategises.

NightsongCamp_7.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_7.text: If this wizard, by your estimation, is a bungling buffoon, it may be best to let him tie himself in knots.

NightsongCamp_15.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_15.text: Then again... it may be best to tie the knot myself.

NightsongCamp_8.speaker: Player
NightsongCamp_8.text: He seems dangerous. I think we ought to put an end to him.

NightsongCamp_50.speaker: Player
NightsongCamp_50.text: He put a bounty out for your capture and now there is a violent mercenary looking for you.

NightsongCamp_9.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_9.text: Let them come, and let them find me. Dame Aylin will strike down any who seek to bring her to harm's home.

NightsongCamp_35.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_35.text: Yet... it is better to cut off the head of the snake than to let its slithering snakelings swarm us unabated. This wizard... this wizard must be held to account.

NightsongCamp_36.speaker: Player
NightsongCamp_36.text: A wizard called Lorroakan was looking to capture you - I went ahead and killed him.

NightsongCamp_39.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_39.text: Ha! Ally mine, you continue to delight.

NightsongCamp_1.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_1.text: I will pray anew to my Moon Mother for your health, wealth, and happiness.

NightsongCamp_22.speaker: Player
NightsongCamp_22.text: I was just wondering what it was like in that cage of Balthazar's.

NightsongCamp_12.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_12.text: Let us not dwell on those dark days. Their memory is a vortex within my heart that leads directly to the Hells.

NightsongCamp_54.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongCamp_54.text: Troubles make a poor supper. Do not hesitate to spit yours out.

PAD_MystraVaultEntered_0.speaker: Player
PAD_MystraVaultEntered_0.text: Each door named after a wizard of renown. The Annals must be behind Karsus' door.

PAD_MystraVaultEntered_1.speaker: Player
PAD_MystraVaultEntered_1.text: Ramazith, Elminster, Silverhand, Karsus. Each door named after a powerful wizard, but what lies behind them?

PAD_MystraVaultEntered_2.speaker: Player
PAD_MystraVaultEntered_2.text: Curious vault - must be protecting something awfully valuable...

Client006_0.speaker: Tiernan Wont
Client006_0.text: You're a fellow bargain hunter, I see. The hidden gems here are far better value than the 'rare' books Tolna keeps locked behind the desk.

Client006_1.speaker: Tiernan Wont
Client006_1.text: 'Rare' might as well mean 'cursed'. What's wrong with some classic Elminster? Maybe a nice bit of Volothamp Geddarm.
Client006_1.context: NodeContext: Genuinely pleased with his bargain bin discoveries

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_30.speaker: Isobel
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_30.context: NodeContext: Relieved/ worried. She's expecting to see Aylin right behind you, but she doesn't

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_8.speaker: Isobel
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_8.text: Gone? What do you mean gone?

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_10.speaker: Player
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_10.text: Lorroakan was too strong. I barely escaped with my life.

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_38.speaker: Player
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_38.text: She's not coming back. Lorroakan has her now. Forget her.

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_34.speaker: Player
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_34.text: Lorroakan is a rich man. I took advantage of that.

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_36.speaker: Player
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_36.text: I have bad news, Isobel. Lorroakan bested her. She's trapped in another soul cage.

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_24.speaker: Isobel
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_24.text: What?! How can - how could some wizard overpower both of you?

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_22.speaker: Isobel
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_22.text: You defeated the Apostle of Myrkul. You mean to tell me this Lorroakan was stronger than the god of necromancy?
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_22.context: NodeContext: Her suspicions are growing; she's seething

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_37.speaker: Player
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_37.text: He must be. I barely escaped with my life.

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_28.speaker: Isobel
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_28.text: He must wield some kind of divine power - or perhaps demonic. Moonmaiden, help me! Not another.

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_27.speaker: Isobel
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_27.text: I need to get her out of there.

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_0.speaker: Player
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_0.text: Don't go, Isobel. He's too strong. He'll kill you.

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_19.speaker: Isobel
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_19.text: So I should just leave her there in that madman's hands? Absolutely not. Absolutely not. Not ever.
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_19.context: NodeContext: Strong emotion. Before she leaves and runs off to save Aylin

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_6.speaker: Player
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_6.text: Are you sure you want to do this?

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_33.speaker: Isobel
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_33.text: I won't abandon her. Not again. Never again.

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_1.speaker: Isobel
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_1.text: If she makes it back before me - tell her I love her. And I'll see her soon.

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_29.speaker: Isobel
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_29.text: Thank you. You've been a true friend. When we come back - and we will - I'll get to thank you properly for standing beside us both.

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_16.speaker: Isobel
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_16.text: You're lying. I can't believe it. You helped him, didn't you?

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_26.speaker: Player
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_26.text: Stronger? No. But a better negotiator? Definitely.

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_5.speaker: Isobel
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_5.text: What did he offer you? Power? Gold?
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_5.context: NodeContext: Suddenly cold. She realizes you betrayed Aylin

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_7.speaker: Isobel
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_7.text: After all the trouble you went through to free her...

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_32.speaker: Isobel
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_32.text: I should strike you down where you stand.

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_17.speaker: Isobel
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_17.text: But I'll leave that to Aylin. I'm sure she will enjoy dealing with you herself.
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_17.context: NodeContext: Vitriol; this is a threat.

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_3.speaker: Player
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_3.text: He offered me more gold than Aylin's freedom is worth.

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_35.speaker: Isobel
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_35.context: NodeContext: Spits on the floor. This is unlike her but the player evoked the animal in her.

Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_15.speaker: Player
Isobel_PostNightsongCaged_15.text: We were defeated and fled. Aylin should be here, unless Lorroakan intercepted her along the way.

RolanPortal_AD_1.speaker: Rolan
RolanPortal_AD_1.text: |There, that will take you to Ramazith's Tower. Try not to anger him.|

RolanConclusion_3.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_3.text: Forgive me - I am in the middle of a most interesting speculation on alchemical blood.
RolanConclusion_3.context: NodeContext: Looking down - studying something. Wishes to be left in peace.

RolanConclusion_6.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_6.text: I need time to cage the Nightsong - kindly give me some.
RolanConclusion_6.context: NodeContext: touch annoyed at the interruption

RolanConclusion_8.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_8.text: Lorroakan is dead. The bastard is dead.
RolanConclusion_8.context: NodeContext: His master has just died and he helped. Mix of emotions - relieved, angry, disbelief

RolanConclusion_90.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_90.text: I am - now that the bastard's in bits.
RolanConclusion_90.context: NodeContext: relieved - with a hint of sadness at what he's gone through

RolanConclusion_78.speaker: Player
RolanConclusion_78.text: 'Bastard'? I thought he was your master.

RolanConclusion_45.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_45.context: NodeContext: clenched fists, he's delighted lorroakan is dead

RolanConclusion_46.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_46.text: Lorroakan was a cruel and vicious man. By day, I'd tend the shop, but at night - he'd fire the most nonsensical questions at me.
RolanConclusion_46.context: NodeContext: lost in a painful memory

RolanConclusion_75.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_75.text: And for every one I answered 'wrong', he'd beat me. I could've killed him with my own two hands, but I kept thinking it was all a test. It had to be.
RolanConclusion_75.context: NodeContext: voice distant with remembered pain

RolanConclusion_5.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_5.text: I thought it was the price I had to pay to become a true wizard. I realise now he was just a sick, sick man.
RolanConclusion_5.context: NodeContext: eyes closed at the beginning (maybe?) dissapointed in himself for trusting lorroakan

RolanConclusion_54.speaker: Player
RolanConclusion_54.text: He's dead now. It's over - and you've won.

RolanConclusion_26.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_26.text: I have. With your considerable help.

RolanConclusion_81.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_81.text: I see things clearly now. If I wish to master the Weave, I must do it myself.

RolanConclusion_9.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_9.text: Thankfully, I have everything I need - right here.
RolanConclusion_9.context: NodeContext: big smile, full of pride - gesturing to the magical tower he stands in - he has achieved his dream. Holds arms out wide

RolanConclusion_44.speaker: Player
RolanConclusion_44.text: All hail Rolan, master of Ramazith's Tower.

RolanConclusion_84.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_84.text: Oh, I like the sound of that! I do indeed.

RolanConclusion_50.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_50.text: I'll move Cal and Lia in immediately. Lorroakan refused to let them stay here. They are going to love the tower.
RolanConclusion_50.context: NodeContext: delight at the thought of showing his family

RolanConclusion_21.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_21.text: I'll move Cal in immediately. Lorroakan refused to let him stay here. He is going to love the library.
RolanConclusion_21.context: NodeContext: delight at the thought of showing his family

RolanConclusion_19.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_19.text: I'll move Lia in immediately. Lorroakan refused to let her stay here. She is going to love the armoury.
RolanConclusion_19.context: NodeContext: delight at the thought of showing his family

RolanConclusion_27.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_27.text: I wouldn't have this - the tower, my family - without you. What can I do to thank you?

RolanConclusion_86.speaker: Player
RolanConclusion_86.text: The city is under siege, from the inside out. I need allies.

RolanConclusion_25.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_25.text: And you'll have me. I'll learn everything I can about the tower in the meantime - even if I have to rip this place apart.

RolanConclusion_73.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_73.text: But know this - Ramazith's Tower, and its master, are now your friends. And when the time comes, we will stand by you as allies.

RolanConclusion_1.speaker: Player
RolanConclusion_1.text: Do what you can to protect the people of Baldur's Gate.

RolanConclusion_79.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_79.text: I will. I'll be the ruler of Ramazith's Tower they deserve - not some vicious recluse who hides from the world.

RolanConclusion_37.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_37.text: Myself and this tower are now your allies. When the time comes, we will stand by you however necessary.

RolanConclusion_95.speaker: Player
RolanConclusion_95.text: I'm sure this place has some interesting trinkets you can part with...

RolanConclusion_83.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_83.text: What's mine is yours - take what you please. Leave only the books and scrolls.

RolanConclusion_7.speaker: Player
RolanConclusion_7.text: You'll be challenged. I'm sure there are others who want the tower.

RolanConclusion_41.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_41.text: Let them come. I happened across a book on the tower's defences, and they are considerable.
RolanConclusion_41.context: NodeContext: a sly smile - a touch of his old arrogance (but in a charming way)

RolanConclusion_55.speaker: Player
RolanConclusion_55.text: Will a room of dusty tomes really help that much?

RolanConclusion_58.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_58.text: Oh, it'll take longer than if I had a master. But I won't entrust my fate to another - not again.
RolanConclusion_58.context: NodeContext: determined with a hint of remembered pain

RolanConclusion_51.speaker: Player
RolanConclusion_51.text: I only wish I could kill Lorroakan all over again.

RolanConclusion_63.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_63.text: I only wish I'd had the pleasure.

RolanConclusion_17.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_17.text: It will take time to tame the Nightsong, but we will do it, I have no doubt.
RolanConclusion_17.context: NodeContext: more demure and restrained then our usual rolan - he's sided with lorroakan and is now his eternal apprentice

RolanConclusion_29.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_29.text: You let my family die - and then you kill my master? Have you made it your personal mission to ruin my life?

RolanConclusion_64.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_64.text: No more - I'll drag you through all Nine Hells myself.
RolanConclusion_64.context: NodeContext: fritted teeth - vicious. About to start combat

RolanConclusion_42.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_42.text: We bested the Nightsong and lived. Lorroakan, however, was not so fortunate.

RolanConclusion_70.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_70.text: Indeed. And all the preparation in the world wouldn't have saved the charlatan from an aasimar.

RolanConclusion_4.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_4.text: Why, my friend, we take what's ours.

RolanConclusion_68.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_68.text: Lorroakan was a vicious bastard - he beat me for the smallest of transgressions.

RolanConclusion_2.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_2.text: He was never going to show me the secrets of Ramazith's Tower. Instead, he'd merely string me along - like a faithful cub.

RolanConclusion_66.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_66.text: But now, I don't need him. I have the tower. I have the Nightsong.

RolanConclusion_20.speaker: Player
RolanConclusion_20.text: Look, I just want to get paid.

RolanConclusion_65.speaker: Player
RolanConclusion_65.text: And if I want the Nightsong for myself?

RolanConclusion_14.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_14.text: Do you happen to have a soul cage lying about with which to contain the limitless power of a furious aasimar?

RolanConclusion_35.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_35.text: Here. Your fee for bringing the Nightsong to me. Lorroakan used me as his purse-holder - idiot needed his fingers to count.

RolanConclusion_82.speaker: Player
RolanConclusion_82.text: What are you going to do to Nightsong?

RolanConclusion_85.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_85.text: Finish what Lorroakan started, of course. I shall cage her and channel her invulnerability.

RolanConclusion_99.speaker: Player
RolanConclusion_99.text: You must be pleased - you've got what you wanted.

RolanConclusion_102.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_102.text: Indeed. I thought it would be an age before Lorroakan keeled over - leaving me Ramazith's Tower.

RolanConclusion_59.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_59.text: I suppose I owe Nightsong some thanks for speeding up the process.

RolanConclusion_16.speaker: Player
RolanConclusion_16.text: A paltry sum for saving you.

RolanConclusion_74.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_74.text: Then consider the power that awaits us once I cage the Nightsong and channel her invulnerability.

RolanConclusion_32.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_32.text: I have mere notes and scrolls to go by - but if that moron Lorroakan can do it, I doubtless can.

RolanConclusion_98.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_98.text: But first, I must cage the aasimar. After that, I have an eternity to begin.

RolanConclusion_34.speaker: Player
RolanConclusion_34.text: You mean we have all this - the tower is mine as much as yours.

RolanConclusion_13.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_13.text: What's mine is yours, friend. But you and I just rendered a celestial unconscious. A very angry celestial.

RolanConclusion_94.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_94.text: I have access to Ramazith's notes, and I have the best chance of dealing with her before she wakes up and murders us both.

RolanConclusion_87.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_87.text: Here. Take Lorroakan's gold in the meantime - spend it as you wish.

RolanConclusion_53.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_53.text: I won't hide behind lies and cheap tricks like Lorroakan. I will rule this tower as it should be - I swear it. Thank you, my friend.

RolanConclusion_71.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_71.text: Seeing what Master Lorroakan is capable of, I know my place is here. Thank you - for settling any doubts.
RolanConclusion_71.context: NodeContext: more demure and restrained then our usual rolan - he's sided with lorroakan and is now his eternal apprentice

RolanConclusion_92.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_92.text: What in the hells happened here?
RolanConclusion_92.context: NodeContext: looking around in shock and horror - accusation towards the player

RolanConclusion_96.speaker: Player
RolanConclusion_96.text: Lorroakan wanted to imprison and torture my friend Nightsong. I couldn't let him hurt her.

RolanConclusion_28.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_28.text: The Nightsong was a person? Yet he still planned to harvest her life? I shouldn't be surprised.
RolanConclusion_28.context: NodeContext: surprise but then brings it back - thinking about his own situation

RolanConclusion_30.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_30.text: You don't understand - I worked my entire life to become Lorroakan's apprentice. And you've ruined it - I can't let you get away with this.
RolanConclusion_30.context: NodeContext: sad but determined - he's going to kill the player

RolanConclusion_56.speaker: Player
RolanConclusion_56.text: Lorroakan wanted to exploit Aylin just like Ketheric did, so I beat some sense into him. Do you have a problem with that?

RolanConclusion_49.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_49.text: Hardly - it doesn't take a 'great wizard' to see that both men deserved to die. In fact - you've done me a favour.
RolanConclusion_49.context: NodeContext: 'you've done me a favour' sad - a bit ashamed at what he's about to explain (about lorroakan beating him)

RolanConclusion_10.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_10.text: You just want Ramazith's Tower for yourself, don't you? No - I refuse to bow to another!

RolanConclusion_62.speaker: Player
RolanConclusion_62.text: I killed Ketheric, now Lorroakan. Do you want to be the next 'great' wizard to die?

RolanConclusion_48.speaker: Player
RolanConclusion_48.text: Same thing that's going to happen to you.

RolanConclusion_91.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_91.text: It's come to this, has it? Fine - I will avenge my master.
RolanConclusion_91.context: NodeContext: vicious - about to start combat

RolanConclusion_97.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_97.text: I knew Lorroakan amassed knowledge like a dragon with its hoard, but never could I have imagined such wealth.
RolanConclusion_97.context: NodeContext: surprise and awe - he can't believe all this is his now

RolanConclusion_88.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_88.text: And the tower itself has a cannon! The sheer power is mind-boggling.
RolanConclusion_88.context: NodeContext: surprise and awe - he can't believe all this is his now

RolanConclusion_93.speaker: Player
RolanConclusion_93.text: What are you going to do with the knowledge you've discovered?

RolanConclusion_12.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_12.text: Study and catalogue it - Lorroakan barely knew his alphabet.

RolanConclusion_57.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_57.text: Then share it with the Realms. After all, it does little good collecting dust in an old tower.
RolanConclusion_57.context: NodeContext: smile - half the reason he's doing this is because the player inspired him

RolanConclusion_52.speaker: Player
RolanConclusion_52.text: A magical cannon? That could come in useful.

RolanConclusion_24.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_24.text: Indeed - I must still figure out its intricacies, but I am close.
RolanConclusion_24.context: NodeContext: gesturing to the table in front of him

RolanConclusion_31.speaker: Player
RolanConclusion_31.text: I'll let you study in peace.

RolanConclusion_0.speaker: Rolan
RolanConclusion_0.context: NodeContext: Looking down at the table in front of him, studying something

NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_4.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_4.text: Ah. Ally mine. We are reunited once more.
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_4.context: NodeContext: Warm, but drained. She's not feeling like herself.

NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_14.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_14.text: I was just regaling sweet Isobel with tales of our prowess.
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_14.context: NodeContext: Warm, but drained. She's not feeling like herself.

NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_10.speaker: Isobel
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_10.text: Very impressive. Thank you for helping Aylin - that wizard sounded absolutely dastardly.
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_10.context: NodeContext: Good humored. Soft in tone. A little uncertain - she's not sure why Aylin isn't herself.

NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_12.speaker: Player
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_12.text: My pleasure. He had it coming.

NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_0.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_0.text: He did, and it came. Now, my friend: bask in your victory. I will do the same.
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_0.context: NodeContext: Warm, but drained. She's not feeling like herself.

NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_5.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_5.text: My darling, we must inform our friend of our news.
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_5.context: NodeContext: Warm, but drained. She's not feeling like herself.

NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_9.speaker: Isobel
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_9.text: Indeed. I've scouted a Selûnite enclave outside the city. They've faced the Absolute's armies and come out battered and bruised. Aylin and I will go to them - provide what help we can.

NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_7.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_7.text: But fear not: when the time comes for you to face the foe of foes, Isobel and I will stand by your side.
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_7.context: NodeContext: Rallying her soldierly spirit, but still a little drained.

NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_11.speaker: Isobel
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_11.text: We wouldn't miss it. Not for anything.
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_11.context: NodeContext: Determination. She's affirming that she'll be here for the end fight.

NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_3.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_3.text: Go well, friend. We will see you soon. And with our great powers combined, this city will be saved.
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_3.context: NodeContext: Rallying her soldierly spirit, but still a little drained.

NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_8.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_8.text: There are always more bastards behind bastards. But we will run through them all, each by each.
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_8.context: NodeContext: Good humored. Soft in tone. A little uncertain - she's not sure why Aylin isn't herself.

NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_13.speaker: Player
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_13.text: I hope you can rest easy now, Dame Aylin.

NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_6.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_6.text: I always do, with darling Isobel by my side.
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_6.context: NodeContext: Good humored. Soft in tone. A little uncertain - she's not sure why Aylin isn't herself.

NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_2.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_2.text: Enjoy the spoils of your victory. Spin memories of Lorroakan's death in your mind like silkfloss.
NightsongAndIsobelCampAfterFight_2.context: NodeContext: Good humored. Soft in tone. A little uncertain - she's not sure why Aylin isn't herself.

AD_GaleSensesKarsusTome_0.speaker: Gale
AD_GaleSensesKarsusTome_0.text: Look - a bookseller. She can point us to the tome I need.
AD_GaleSensesKarsusTome_0.context: NodeContext: Spotting a book seller at the back of the shop. Determined - we need to go there.

Krank_0.speaker: Krank
Krank_0.context: NodeContext: Pneumatic metal robot animated armour sounds.

Krank_1.speaker: Krank
Krank_1.context: NodeContext: Pneumatic metal robot animated armour sounds.

AD_RolanReactLorroakanDeath_0.speaker: Rolan
AD_RolanReactLorroakanDeath_0.context: NodeContext: confusion, then shock and worry as he sees his dead master

Aradin_32.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_32.text: Let me back in, or bring Lorroakan out here, you tin tube.

Aradin_42.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_42.text: You tell Lorroakan I went for his godsdamned Nightsong, and now he has to pay up. What're you looking at?
Aradin_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: On "What're you looking at?" Aradin notices player and turns to face themNodeContext: First line to Klank, second line to player

Aradin_53.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_53.text: Shit, it's you. You went looking for the Nightsong after me. Please tell me you found it.

Aradin_85.speaker: Player
Aradin_85.text: Who are you trying to get at inside?

Aradin_24.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_24.text: Lorroakan - the wizard who set out the contract. He owns this place. And his little pageboy inside knows how to get to him.

Aradin_19.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_19.text: Lorroakan said it'd be easy money - a smash and grab. Get in, get the Nightsong, go.

Aradin_11.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_11.text: Turns out his little relic was in a temple of Shar, beneath an army of goblins. Would never have taken my people in if I'd known.

Aradin_22.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_22.text: I can't bring 'em back. But I can make Lorroakan cough up. Especially if you found the relic.
Aradin_22.context: NodeContext: Sadly, through his tough mean exterior. (loh-ROW-ah-kun)

Aradin_61.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_61.text: Answer the question. Did you find it or not?
Aradin_61.context: NodeContext: With threat in his voice

Aradin_95.speaker: Player
Aradin_95.text: I found the Nightsong. Turns out it wasn't a relic, but an aasimar.

Aradin_102.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_102.text: An aasimar? Hells. If I'd known, I'd have asked for more gold - kidnapping costs more than theft.

Aradin_104.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_104.text: Don't forget I'm the one who gave you that contract. I want my cut.
Aradin_104.context: NodeContext: 'Name of Balduran,' a mild oath

Aradin_0.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_0.text: Good luck getting a blue copper out of Lorroakan. Guy's tighter than a blacknose sheep.

Aradin_75.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_75.text: You get that money, you come find me. Or I'll come looking for you.

Aradin_39.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_39.text: Hope you lost fewer people along the way than I did. Bloody goblins. Lorroakan should've warned us.
Aradin_39.context: NodeContext: Second part said as though to Lorroakan in the shop he's trying to enter.

Aradin_48.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_48.text: You're lying. Can't say I blame you. Thing's worth a fortune.

Aradin_46.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_46.text: Hope you hid it well, mate.

Aradin_92.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_92.text: Maybe. I don't know you, though. And I'd thank you to get out of my face.

Aradin_66.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_66.text: Lorroakan. Wizard that owns that shop. Sent me on a wild goose chase into a hive of goblins for some relic. Said it would be an easy take.

Aradin_15.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_15.text: I lost good people. Good friends. The 'Nightsong' my arse.

Aradin_33.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_33.context: NodeContext: Very aggro, ready to fight the player.

Aradin_6.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_6.text: I've lost good people to the wizard that owns that shop. Lorroakan. Offered a huge pile of cash to chase down some relic called the 'Nightsong'.

Aradin_97.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_97.text: If he'd mentioned it was buried under a goblin hive, I'd never have taken my people there. He owes me. A lot.

Aradin_105.speaker: Player
Aradin_105.text: What does he want with the Nightsong?

Aradin_29.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_29.text: Don't know. Don't care. But he did offer a king's ransom for its return.

Aradin_26.speaker: Player
Aradin_26.text: I found the Nightsong, actually. Turns out it wasn't a relic, but an aasimar.

Aradin_45.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_45.text: An aasimar... you found it?! Where is it?
Aradin_45.context: NodeContext: On 'an aasimar,' he's surprised, coming to terms with this fact quickly. ('AH-sim-ar')

Aradin_78.speaker: Player
Aradin_78.text: She's in my camp. If you want to turn her in, you're going to have to take her down yourself.

Aradin_70.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_70.text: Still alive, is she? You better be telling the truth, and you better not get in my way.

Aradin_40.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_40.text: I'm not losing any more people. Not any good ones, anyway.

Aradin_62.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_62.text: I'll need to see who's around. But with cash like what Lorroakan's offering, I don't think I'll have any trouble recruiting help.

Aradin_107.speaker: Player
Aradin_107.text: She's long gone by now. There's no reward to be had.

Aradin_74.speaker: Player
Aradin_74.text: Don't get ahead of yourself. Lorroakan wanted her alive - and she's dead.

Aradin_89.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_89.text: And I suppose you were stupid enough to kill her?

Aradin_94.speaker: Player
Aradin_94.text: She's immortal. And tough. You can forget about turning her in for a reward.

Aradin_41.speaker: Aradin
