Aradin_41.text: Immortal, eh? Interesting. Won't be easy getting her back to the wizard, but if you don't do it, someone else will.

Aradin_90.speaker: Player
Aradin_90.text: She's gone - I'm not sure where to.

Aradin_99.speaker: Player
Aradin_99.text: She's gone - I'm not sure where to.

Aradin_17.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_17.text: Son of a bastard's whore. You had a small fortune in your grasp, and you let it go?!

Aradin_79.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_79.text: I ought to knock some sense into you, but you know what? I'm too godsdamn tired.

Aradin_59.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_59.text: I gave your boy Helm a shot, you know. Stopped by a shrine of his. Even offered up a copper. And do you know what I got in return? One less copper.

Aradin_16.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_16.text: I thought about what you said before, by the way. About Tyr. Wondered if I might've missed a trick, not having a god in my corner.

Aradin_43.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_43.text: But then I started to wonder why I'd worship someone who had the power to help people, but chose not to unless they bowed before him. You can't answer me that, can you?

Aradin_14.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_14.text: If she's out there, I'm gonna find her. You mark my words.

Aradin_82.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_82.text: Sod it. Enough. Lorroakan and his precious Nightsong just about ruined my life. If you value yours, I'd steer well clear of this place.
Aradin_82.context: NodeContext: Grim and sarcastic on the 'good luck, pal.' (loh-ROW-ah-kun)

Aradin_96.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_96.text: I tried praying to your fella Tempus, by the way. Down on my knees and everything. Felt like a fool. Still do.

Aradin_4.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_4.text: How dumb do you think I am? You're hiding her. Can't blame you for wanting the reward for yourself.

Aradin_52.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_52.text: Hope you hid her well, mate.
Aradin_52.context: NodeContext: Meancing. He's going to find her.

Aradin_57.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_57.text: Only place I'm going is wherever you've got the aasimar stashed.

Aradin_35.speaker: Player
Aradin_35.text: To chase the Nightsong is to once more rush into danger - reflect on your past mistakes.

Aradin_30.speaker: Player
Aradin_30.text: I'm sorry to hear about your friends.

Aradin_76.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_76.text: 'Sorry' won't bring 'em back, pay their debts, or compensate me for my trouble.

Aradin_21.speaker: Player
Aradin_21.text: Last time I saw you, you'd cleaned the clock of a tiefling named Zevlor.

Aradin_58.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_58.text: Oh yeah. That prick. You should probably get out of my way unless you want the same treatment.

Aradin_27.speaker: Player
Aradin_27.text: Last time I saw you, you'd been knocked out by a tiefling named Zevlor.

Aradin_3.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_3.text: Guy was a prick. So were you, if memory serves.

Aradin_9.speaker: Player
Aradin_9.text: Last time I saw you, I'd cleaned your clock.

Aradin_31.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_31.text: You're lucky I'm not in the mood for payback.

Aradin_5.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_5.text: Why don't you move along before you start regretting hanging around?

Aradin_69.speaker: Player
Aradin_69.text: Last time I saw you, you almost came to blows with Zevlor back in the druid's grove.

Aradin_60.speaker: Player
Aradin_60.text: I'm looking at the idiot making all the noise.

Aradin_2.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_2.text: I can knock you out if the noise is bothering you.

Aradin_55.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_55.text: Should have pounded that rustbucket into scrap as soon as it kicked me out of the shop.

Aradin_86.speaker: Aradin
Aradin_86.text: But it won't do me no good. So if you're looking for a 'thank you', look somewhere else.

AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_2.speaker: Heder Cross
AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_2.text: Mumbus, if I were a lava elemental, I'd get a job in a restaurant.

AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_7.speaker: Heder Cross
AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_7.text: Mmhmm, 'cause I could cook food right on my body so I wouldn't even need an oven.

AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_16.speaker: Thalita Cross
AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_16.text: You make a fine point. Very efficient, you'd be.

AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_4.speaker: Heder Cross
AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_4.text: No fish, only chicken, beef, and vegetals. No pork either.
AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_4.context: NodeContext: Vegetals on purpose, kid is mispronouncing

AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_0.speaker: Thalita Cross
AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_0.text: It'd be your body; you'd make the rules.

AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_23.speaker: Thalita Cross
AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_23.text: If you're bored and I'm wrong, where have Jaremy and his mother gone?

AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_12.speaker: Heder Cross
AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_12.text: Mumbus, why are lava elementals so hot?

AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_18.speaker: Thalita Cross
AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_18.text: Because they're made of fire, darling.

AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_11.speaker: Heder Cross
AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_11.text: If a lava elemental is made of fire, what am I made of?

AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_5.speaker: Thalita Cross
AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_5.text: Many things, I suppose. Blood, bile, phlegm, chocolate...

AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_21.speaker: Thalita Cross
AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_21.context: NodeContext: Winding him up to believe people are made of chocolate.

AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_14.speaker: Thalita Cross
AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_14.text: In a little. I've got a bit more shopping to do.

AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_19.speaker: Thalita Cross
AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_19.text: Figaro's, to pick up some hair ointment for your father.

AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_6.speaker: Heder Cross
AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_6.text: But dad doesn't have any hair.

AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_13.speaker: Thalita Cross
AD_MomAndSonNearElemental_13.text: That's why we need the ointment.

Lorroakan_Dead_11.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_Dead_11.text: How did you become the owner of this place?

Lorroakan_Dead_20.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_Dead_20.text: Ramazith... gone... Open for the taking...

Lorroakan_Dead_1.speaker: Narrator
Lorroakan_Dead_1.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

Lorroakan_Dead_12.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_Dead_12.text: How did you learn to imprison the Nightsong?

Lorroakan_Dead_17.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_Dead_17.text: Who is more powerful, you or your apprentice?

Lorroakan_Dead_2.speaker: Narrator
Lorroakan_Dead_2.text: *The corpse pauses, perhaps resisting the truth.*

Lorroakan_Dead_21.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_Dead_21.text: Where do you store your valuables?

Lorroakan_Dead_13.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_Dead_13.text: Lower floor... magic repository... vault key...

Lorroakan_Dead_14.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_Dead_14.text: Any security measures I should be aware of in your repository?

Lorroakan_Dead_23.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_Dead_23.text: Traps... spells... deathly to the touch...

Lorroakan_Dead_9.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_Dead_9.text: How do I avoid the traps?

Lorroakan_Dead_18.speaker: Narrator
Lorroakan_Dead_18.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Lorroakan_Dead_25.speaker: Narrator
Lorroakan_Dead_25.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

AD_PuzzlePortalImmortality_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_PuzzlePortalImmortality_0.text: *The Nightsong is an immortal being, the child of a deity.*

AnimatedArmor_0.speaker: Narrator
AnimatedArmor_0.text: *The armour appears inanimate, though a spark of life force still radiates from the disjointed metal.*

AnimatedArmor_1.speaker: Narrator
AnimatedArmor_1.text: *The animated armour has reformed, unphased by its recent trip to oblivion.*

AnimatedArmor_2.context: NodeContext: Animated armour g eneric sound

RolanProjectionWarning_1.speaker: Rolan's Projection
RolanProjectionWarning_1.text: Interfering with the magical staff of Sorcerous Sundries is prohibited. Any further transgressions, and you will be banned.
RolanProjectionWarning_1.context: NodeContext: as a projection - cheery but stern warning

RolanProjectionWarning_5.speaker: Rolan's Projection
RolanProjectionWarning_5.text: Congratulations - you have been banned from Sorcerous Sundries. You will now be escorted outside.
RolanProjectionWarning_5.context: NodeContext: as a projection - cheery but stern warning

RolanProjectionWarning_4.speaker: Rolan's Projection
RolanProjectionWarning_4.text: Sorcerous Sundries assumes no responsibility for the harm you are about to suffer.
RolanProjectionWarning_4.context: NodeContext: as a projection - cheery but stern warning

RolanProjectionWarning_0.speaker: Rolan's Projection
RolanProjectionWarning_0.context: NodeContext: as a projection - cheery but stern warning

Client007_0.speaker: Big Clive
Client007_0.text: Excuse me, can't stop - there's only so much shopping time left before the Absolute breaches the city.

Client007_1.speaker: Big Clive
Client007_1.text: Did I not tell you I was busy? If I have to hole up in my basement without my favourite parchment, I'll go spare!

PAD_ReactionToTharchiateCodex_1.speaker: Player
PAD_ReactionToTharchiateCodex_1.text: These glyphs look familiar - they were in 'The Necromancy of Thay'.

Lia_0.speaker: Lia
Lia_0.text: Heard you put that prick Lorroakan in the ground - good. Only sad I couldn't help.
Lia_0.context: NodeContext: fierce - wished she had been there to help rolan

Lia_3.speaker: Lia
Lia_3.text: Thank you - for having Rolan's back. You just can't stop saving us, can you?

Lia_1.speaker: Lia
Lia_1.text: I once thought the best we could hope for in Baldur's Gate was a room above the Blushing Mermaid...
Lia_1.context: NodeContext: Looking around - smile on her face

Lia_2.speaker: Lia
Lia_2.context: NodeContext: Gestures around her - sad smile (cal is dead)

Client004_0.speaker: Cappa Delourese
Client004_0.text: My advice? Cobble together what you can from what's left and wait for this all to blow over.

Client004_1.speaker: Cappa Delourese
Client004_1.text: There's not much left - look like folks heard the Absolute was on the march and bought everything that wasn't nailed down.

PAD_LorroakanImmortal_0.speaker: Player
PAD_LorroakanImmortal_0.text: There we have it. Lorroakan the immortal.

CursedTomeKarsus_5.speaker: Narrator
CursedTomeKarsus_5.text: *These notes are no mere diary. These are the visions of Karsus himself. Designs for the crown he hoped to forge, and the new form of magic he planned to create with it.*
CursedTomeKarsus_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale ponders after having read a book with potentially world-changing knowledge within. The book is open in his hands, but not in shot.

CursedTomeKarsus_4.speaker: Narrator
CursedTomeKarsus_4.text: *He almost succeeded. The crown sits atop the elder brain, and the Karsite Weave rests within your chest, incomplete but already capable of immense destruction.*

CursedTomeKarsus_15.speaker: Narrator
CursedTomeKarsus_15.text: *Reunite the crown with the Dead Three's Netherstones, and you would have total control over it. The power of a god, in your hands.*

CursedTomeKarsus_10.speaker: Player
CursedTomeKarsus_10.text: The broken artefacts of a failed god. The crown should be destroyed, before it causes any more damage.

CursedTomeKarsus_9.speaker: Narrator
CursedTomeKarsus_9.text: *Though Karsus could only have worn the crown for mere moments, he managed to destroy an empire, killing thousands in the process.

CursedTomeKarsus_6.speaker: Narrator
CursedTomeKarsus_6.text: *In the hands of the Dead Three's Chosen, it threatens to do much the same. You must find a way to stop them, to render the crown harmless. Detonating the power of the Karsite Weave, if necessary.*

CursedTomeKarsus_18.speaker: Narrator
CursedTomeKarsus_18.text: *You can save Faerûn from Karsus' evil, and the Absolute's in one fell swoop. Only, you might not live to enjoy it.*

CursedTomeKarsus_13.speaker: Narrator
CursedTomeKarsus_13.text: *In the hands of the Dead Three's Chosen, it threatens to do much the same. You must find a way to stop them, to render the crown harmless. Detonating the orb, if necessary.*

CursedTomeKarsus_12.speaker: Player
CursedTomeKarsus_12.text: You always liked the idea of being worshipped. Adored. Obeyed...

CursedTomeKarsus_20.speaker: Narrator
CursedTomeKarsus_20.text: *Few mortals are truly capable of ascending to godhood. Karsus famously failed, but that doesn't mean you would share his fate.*

CursedTomeKarsus_11.speaker: Narrator
CursedTomeKarsus_11.text: *After all, Mystra herself was once no more than a mortal wizard. She has no more right than any other. It's time someone else had a go. Someone with more... ambition.*

CursedTomeKarsus_19.speaker: Narrator
CursedTomeKarsus_19.text: *Of course, there's still the matter of your deal with Raphael. Unless your contract with him is destroyed, the crown is his to claim.*

CursedTomeKarsus_14.speaker: Player
CursedTomeKarsus_14.text: Better not get ahead of yourself. The crown is still out of reach, for now.

CursedTomeKarsus_3.speaker: Narrator
CursedTomeKarsus_3.text: *Between you and the crown there's the small matter of the elder brain to contend with. Not to mention the deal you made with Raphael.*
CursedTomeKarsus_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale ponders after having read a book with potentially world-changing knowledge within (book does not need to be shown)

CursedTomeKarsus_0.speaker: Narrator
CursedTomeKarsus_0.text: *Between you and the crown there's the small matter of the elder brain to contend with.*
CursedTomeKarsus_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale ponders after having read a book with potentially world-changing knowledge within (book does not need to be shown)

CursedTomeKarsus_2.speaker: Narrator
CursedTomeKarsus_2.text: *For now, whatever designs of your own with regards to the crown will have to wait. But not for long. It will be in your hands soon enough, and you have quite the decision to make.*

CursedTomeKarsus_7.speaker: Narrator
CursedTomeKarsus_7.text: *It seems Raphael was telling you the truth. The crown you saw atop the elder brain is indeed of Karsus' making.*
CursedTomeKarsus_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale ponders after having read a book with potentially world-changing knowledge within (book does not need to be shown)

CursedTomeKarsus_1.speaker: Narrator
CursedTomeKarsus_1.text: *Reunite the crown with the Dead Three's Netherstones, and Karsus' design might yet be completed. You could wield the power of a god.*

CursedTomeKarsus_8.speaker: Narrator
CursedTomeKarsus_8.text: *This was the crown you witnessed atop the elder brain. Not just any Netherese artefact, but the means of Karsus' godhood.*
CursedTomeKarsus_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale ponders after having read a book with potentially world-changing knowledge within (book does not need to be shown)

PAD_NightsongLeftAfterBetrayal_0.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongLeftAfterBetrayal_0.text: Dame Aylin's nowhere to be seen. We've made a powerful enemy if she slipped through Rolan's fingers.

LorroakanConclusion_0.speaker: Lorroakan
LorroakanConclusion_0.text: I do not give you leave to speak. In fact, I suggest you leave Ramazith's Tower immediately. We have no further business.

LorroakanConclusion_7.speaker: Lorroakan
LorroakanConclusion_7.text: Aha! When last we met, mercenary, I had yet to attain my true form.

LorroakanConclusion_2.speaker: Lorroakan
LorroakanConclusion_2.text: Witness me - immortal, until the end of all days.

LorroakanConclusion_27.speaker: Lorroakan
LorroakanConclusion_27.text: It does. I was born for power. Made for it. And now, high above the tides of fate, I feel, at last, at home.

LorroakanConclusion_22.speaker: Lorroakan
LorroakanConclusion_22.text: I thank you for your role in my ascension. I hope you're enjoying your newfound wealth. It pleases me to reward my faithful.

LorroakanConclusion_30.speaker: Player
LorroakanConclusion_30.text: It's wonderful to see someone achieve their dreams.

LorroakanConclusion_29.speaker: Lorroakan
LorroakanConclusion_29.text: It was no dream I had - it was a plan. Carefully crafted, carefully executed by sheer force of genius.

LorroakanConclusion_19.speaker: Player
LorroakanConclusion_19.text: Genius? You paid me to do your work for you.

LorroakanConclusion_13.speaker: Lorroakan
LorroakanConclusion_13.text: You cannot question me. I am as a god. And you are a bit of dross washed in by the tide of fate.

LorroakanConclusion_3.speaker: Lorroakan
LorroakanConclusion_3.text: A tide to which I am no longer beholden. Ah, the freedom. You would never understand.

LorroakanConclusion_4.speaker: Lorroakan
LorroakanConclusion_4.text: Fitting. I thank you. And now, I give you leave to go.

LorroakanConclusion_17.speaker: Lorroakan
LorroakanConclusion_17.text: Swimming above the tides of fate, I see so much for me to do. So very much indeed.

LorroakanConclusion_10.speaker: Lorroakan
LorroakanConclusion_10.text: I suggest you leave before your disrespect is met with an appropriate rebuke.

LorroakanConclusion_6.speaker: Lorroakan
LorroakanConclusion_6.text: And a word of advice? Humble yourself. There are powers far greater than you at play. And not all are as merciful as I.

LorroakanConclusion_18.speaker: Lorroakan
LorroakanConclusion_18.text: I give you leave to go - so be gone. And do not call upon Ramazith's Tower again. When I see its services might be of use to you, I will rally of my own accord.

LorroakanConclusion_9.speaker: Lorroakan
LorroakanConclusion_9.text: It is done - it is done! Now - I must fit her into the device before she resurrects. You - take your payment - well earned - and be gone.
LorroakanConclusion_9.context: NodeContext: Slavering hurried excitement; he got what he wanted after the player helped him fight Nightsong.

LorroakanConclusion_32.speaker: Lorroakan
LorroakanConclusion_32.text: Come, boy, don't stand there gawping. We have much work to do.

LorroakanConclusion_25.speaker: Player
LorroakanConclusion_25.text: A pleasure doing business with you.

LorroakanConclusion_33.speaker: Lorroakan
LorroakanConclusion_33.context: NodeContext: Impatient, trying to get player ot leave.

LorroakanConclusion_28.speaker: Lorroakan
LorroakanConclusion_28.text: Go cry into your sack of gold.

LorroakanConclusion_16.speaker: Player
LorroakanConclusion_16.text: What will you do with your immortality, Lorroakan?

LorroakanConclusion_24.speaker: Lorroakan
LorroakanConclusion_24.text: Whatever I wish. Forever, forever, whatever I wish.

LorroakanConclusion_8.speaker: Lorroakan
LorroakanConclusion_8.text: You've made a powerful ally today, you know. This tower's capabilities are exceptional, and your enemies are now my own, should I wish them to be.

LorroakanConclusion_21.speaker: Lorroakan
LorroakanConclusion_21.text: You can count on Ramazith's Tower in future. Something tells me you won't leave Baldur's Gate without a few... fireworks.

LorroakanConclusion_20.speaker: Lorroakan
LorroakanConclusion_20.text: Witness me - immortal, until the end of all days.

Miklaur_0.speaker: Miklaur
Miklaur_0.text: You'll bring him the Nightsong, won't you? He'll be so very pleased, so very happy, if his plans materialise.
Miklaur_0.context: NodeContext: eing very positive about Lorroakan but he's terrified of the man inside.

Miklaur_2.speaker: Miklaur
Miklaur_2.text: I do hope you'll do as Master Lorroakan says. He's quite a brilliant man.
Miklaur_2.context: NodeContext: Being very positive about Lorroakan but he's terrified of the man inside.

AD_PuzzlePortalPotion_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_PuzzlePortalPotion_0.text: *The Nightsong is an ancient potion that allows its drinker to become irresistably attractive to man and god alike.*

Tolna_29.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_29.text: (That's better. How can I help you?

Tolna_103.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_103.text: (Look what you've done! By all the gods! I'd give my ear for the least bit of respect for the written word.)

Tolna_38.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_38.text: (Go act the clown on your own time. Come back when you've cobbled together some manners and are prepared to pay for the damages!)

Tolna_106.speaker: Player
Tolna_106.text: Sorry about that, I now understand books need to be well treated. Lesson learned. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

Tolna_30.speaker: Player
Tolna_30.text: (How might I get permission to enter the vault?)

Tolna_136.speaker: Player
Tolna_136.text: I'm trying to find out about a particular Netherese crown. Have you anything on that subject?

Tolna_70.speaker: Player
Tolna_70.text: (I'm trying to find out about a particular Netherese crown. Have you anything on that subject?)

Tolna_42.speaker: Player
Tolna_42.text: I'd be interested in any especially rare tomes you might have.

Tolna_67.speaker: Player
Tolna_67.text: (I'd be interested in any especially rare tomes you might have.)

Tolna_68.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_68.text: (Bold! You might've heard that our library has a collection other shops would lack the skill to curate.)

Tolna_69.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_69.text: (Between us, even Master Lorroakan was reluctant to house them in his tower. The pen is mightier than the magic wand, apparently.)
Tolna_69.context: NodeContext: With a bit of a giggle, since she's saying her books are more powerful than Lorroakan (loh-ROW-ah-kun)

Tolna_117.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_117.text: (They're locked away here for their and our customers' safety. Our finest reserve includes the 'Tharchiate Codex', 'The Annals of Karsus: A Netherese Folly', 'Sights of the Seelie', and 'The Curriculum of Strategy'. Do any of those interest you?)

Tolna_102.speaker: Player
Tolna_102.text: ('The Annals of Karsus: A Netherese Folly'.)

Tolna_120.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_120.text: (It is said to be written by Lord Karsus himself, the Netherese arcanist who attempted to replace the goddess Mystra, failed, and was banished for the attempt.)

Tolna_87.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_87.text: (Great magical knowledge lies within those pages, but not many can withstand it.)

Tolna_58.speaker: Gale
Tolna_58.context: NodeContext: Discreet whisper to player, as if in a library

Tolna_11.speaker: Gale
Tolna_11.text: (I can't explain now, but it's very important we get hold of that book. Very, very important.)
Tolna_11.context: NodeContext: Discreet whisper to player, as if in a library

Tolna_17.speaker: Narrator
Tolna_17.text: *The Annals of Karsus. Where better to learn the secrets of the crown than in the writings of the one who might have forged it?*

Tolna_12.speaker: Narrator
Tolna_12.text: *The Annals of Karsus. Where better to learn the secrets of the crown than in a book written by the greatest of Netherese wizards?*

Tolna_92.speaker: Narrator
Tolna_92.text: *Karsus himself was rumoured to have created a crown of untold power. Could this be the crown being used to control the elder brain?*

Tolna_41.speaker: Narrator
Tolna_41.text: *'The Annals of Karsus' would no doubt have much to say about the crown's true nature, if only you could read them...*

Tolna_139.speaker: Player
Tolna_139.text: (Sounds perfect. How much for me to buy it from you?)

Tolna_33.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_33.text: (Buy? Books as temperamental as these are not on sale. They are secured in our vault, where none can harm them, nor can they do any harm.)
Tolna_33.context: NodeContext: Almost amused at the thought such books would be for sale - shutting the prospect down.

Tolna_48.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_48.text: (Consider yourself lucky to have learned of such a book's existence. And then forget about it - the Annals of Karsus are best left unread.)

Tolna_27.speaker: Player
Tolna_27.text: (Surely there's some amount of gold that could convince you to part with the book?)

Tolna_107.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_107.text: (Pssht. I already told you - it is locked in our vault. And with good reason - imagine if a tome so dangerous were sold to someone with such poor comprehension...)
Tolna_107.context: NodeContext: Turtting to herself on the last part of the lines

Tolna_39.speaker: Player
Tolna_39.text: (I came here all the way from Neverwinter to admire your collection. Couldn't I just peek in the vault?)

Tolna_143.speaker: Player
Tolna_143.text: (Unless you want a very nasty paper cut, you're going to tell me how to get into that vault.)

Tolna_125.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_125.text: (Customers like you are why I prefer the company of books.)
Tolna_125.context: NodeContext: With a sigh - reluctantly going to tell you something

Tolna_133.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_133.text: (The only way to gain access to the vault is through my office. And before you ask - no, you are not allowed in there either.)

Tolna_83.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_83.text: (The vault is strictly prohibited for customers. And if you don't cease this foolishness, the rest of Sorcerous Sundries will be as well.)
Tolna_83.context: NodeContext: Scolding - not interested in whatever game you're playing

Tolna_122.speaker: Player
Tolna_122.text: (Isn't it your job to share knowledge, not keep it locked away? At least tell me where the vault is...)

Tolna_54.speaker: Player
Tolna_54.text: (Isn't it your job to share knowledge, not keep it locked away? At least tell me where the vault is...)

Tolna_22.speaker: Player
Tolna_22.text: (Thank you. I've learned more than enough.)

Tolna_66.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_66.text: (You certainly have. Even simple knowledge of these tomes is enough to stimulate most.)

Tolna_130.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_130.text: (Interesting choice. If I didn't know better, I'd think you might have 'The Necromancy of Thay' in your possession.)

Tolna_20.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_20.text: (I'd advise tremendous care with the 'Tharchiate Codex'. The cost of unlocking its mysteries is onerous.)

Tolna_8.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_8.text: (Its author was a spectacularly talented halfling. She was - allegedly - able to establish contact with members of the Seelie Court.)

Tolna_89.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_89.text: (Can you even imagine what wonders the fey pantheon might've revealed? Incredible.)

Tolna_85.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_85.text: (You've heard about the Red Knight, I trust? Devout strategist, made exarch of Tempus.)

Tolna_128.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_128.text: (This treaty is a compilation of her own design, kept here on the Material Plane for the benefit of us mortals. Quite rare.)

Tolna_7.speaker: Player
Tolna_7.text: (Can I buy one of these rare tomes?)

Tolna_131.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_131.text: (I'm happy to describe the wonders that lie between their covers, but I'm afraid purchasing them is simply out of the question.)

Tolna_35.speaker: Narrator
Tolna_35.text: *Tolna may prefer to whisper, but it's her silence now speaking volumes. These books will never be for sale.*

Tolna_141.speaker: Player
Tolna_141.text: (I came here all the way from Neverwinter to admire your collection. Couldn't I just peek in the vault?)

Tolna_49.speaker: Player
Tolna_49.text: (Unless you want a very nasty paper cut, you're going to tell me how to get into that vault.)

Tolna_79.speaker: Player
Tolna_79.text: (Isn't it your job to share knowledge, not keep it locked away? At least tell me where the vault is...)

Tolna_62.speaker: Player
Tolna_62.text: (Isn't it your job to share knowledge, not keep it locked away? At least tell me where the vault is...)

Tolna_40.speaker: Player
Tolna_40.text: IS THAT TRUE, BOOKS? ARE YOU SENSITIVE?

Tolna_56.speaker: Player
Tolna_56.text: HOW ARE YOU FEELING, BOOKS? STILL SENSITIVE?

Tolna_1.speaker: Player
Tolna_1.text: What do you think of the new master of the tower?

Tolna_4.speaker: Player
Tolna_4.text: So Lorroakan got his Nightsong after all.

Tolna_105.speaker: Player
Tolna_105.text: The master of the tower is dead - I'm not sure he has a replacement. What will you do?

Tolna_63.speaker: Player
Tolna_63.text: (What do you think of the new master of the tower?)

Tolna_127.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_127.text: (Who now? Oh. Rolan. I leave him alone. He leaves me alone. That's all there is to it, I'm happy to say.)

Tolna_121.speaker: Player
Tolna_121.text: (So Lorroakan got his Nightsong after all.)

Tolna_134.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_134.text: (I'd prefer not to discuss that beastly business.)

Tolna_119.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_119.text: (Sorcerous Sundries is an institution of this city, one I am proud to serve, even if it passes through some rather loathsome hands from time to time.)

Tolna_21.speaker: Player
Tolna_21.text: (The master of the tower is dead - I'm not sure he has a replacement. What will you do?)

Tolna_91.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_91.text: (The same as I've always done. I deal in knowledge, not proprietors. Quietly getting on with things is a virtue, you know.)

Tolna_80.speaker: Player
Tolna_80.text: A quiet haven surrounded by books. I could get used to this.

Tolna_118.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_118.text: (Whisht! These books are sensitive. They prefer an environment of quiet reverence.)
Tolna_118.context: NodeContext: Shushing the player, finger in front of mouth like a librarian

Tolna_46.speaker: Player
Tolna_46.text: (A quiet haven, surrounded by books. I could get used to this.)

Tolna_5.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_5.text: (Wouldn't trade it for the world, so I wouldn't. Anything I can help you with?)

Tolna_90.speaker: Player
Tolna_90.text: What do you have on offer?

Tolna_77.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
Tolna_77.text: (Scrolls, parchments, codices, tomes... Take a look and see what calls you.)

NightsongConclusion_7.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongConclusion_7.text: I will return to camp shortly. I just need a moment to... to...

NightsongConclusion_12.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongConclusion_12.text: The fire-haired fool is dead. Yet as I stare upon his corpse, I feel... sadness. Why?
NightsongConclusion_12.context: NodeContext: Slow and curious, angry and confused by all that has happened.

NightsongConclusion_5.speaker: Player
NightsongConclusion_5.text: What kind of sadness is it?

NightsongConclusion_2.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongConclusion_2.text: A gripping in the chest. As though I'd lost someone, something.
NightsongConclusion_2.context: NodeContext: Lost in thought for a moment; confused.

NightsongConclusion_9.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongConclusion_9.text: A paladin's fatigue, no doubt. You were excellent in battle, as is your way. And I am proud to fight at your side.
NightsongConclusion_9.context: NodeContext: REmembering herself. She is Dame Aylin.

NightsongConclusion_1.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongConclusion_1.text: And you - tiefling! You did not embarrass yourself.

NightsongConclusion_13.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongConclusion_13.text: I will catch my breath, then to camp I will bring my bones. Moonmaiden be with you.

NightsongConclusion_6.speaker: Player
NightsongConclusion_6.text: Perhaps smiting has lost its pleasures.

NightsongConclusion_8.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongConclusion_8.text: Say it can't be so. For I am Selûne's sword. And ever must be.
NightsongConclusion_8.context: NodeContext: She means it, but on the periphery of her consciousness is a tiny crack. Wondering about her fate. (Selûne's = seh-LOO-nuh's)

NightsongConclusion_0.speaker: Player
NightsongConclusion_0.text: Because you won't get to kill him again?

NightsongConclusion_4.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongConclusion_4.text: Perhaps. Yet if I could run him through a thousand times, I wonder -
NightsongConclusion_4.context: NodeContext: Lost in thought, she's been triggered to remember her own fate being run through over and over.

NightsongConclusion_10.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongConclusion_10.text: Battle has tired my mind, made me susceptible to flights of fancy. You were excellent in battle, as is your way. And I am proud to fight at your side.

NightsongConclusion_11.speaker: Player
NightsongConclusion_11.text: I know something of sadness - or at least the ballads do. What does it feel like?

AD_ClientReading_0.speaker: Tiernan Wont
AD_ClientReading_0.text: Is this a signed copy? Oh, by Volothamp Geddarm himself! How delightful!

AD_ClientReading_1.speaker: Tiernan Wont
AD_ClientReading_1.text: I simply must have it. How much...?

AD_ClientReading_6.speaker: Tiernan Wont
AD_ClientReading_6.context: NodeContext: Abruptly changes his mind - it's too expensive for him

AD_ClientReading_3.speaker: Tiernan Wont
AD_ClientReading_3.text: 'Goblin Party Cooking'? What's that doing in here?

AD_ClientReading_10.speaker: Tiernan Wont
AD_ClientReading_10.text: It must have some sort of merit if Sorcerous Sundries stocks it, I suppose.

AD_ClientReading_2.speaker: Tiernan Wont
AD_ClientReading_2.text: Well, at least they seem to use the... everything... of everything. Not a title for me, I think.
AD_ClientReading_2.context: NodeContext: A little disgusted at the content of the goblin recipe book

AD_ClientReading_7.speaker: Tiernan Wont
AD_ClientReading_7.text: Let's see - I'm sure there's gold in these stacks somewhere...
AD_ClientReading_7.context: NodeContext: Thinking aloud as he pores through books

AD_ClientReading_4.speaker: Tiernan Wont
AD_ClientReading_4.text: No, this was here last week.
AD_ClientReading_4.context: NodeContext: Dismissive of the book he's found

AD_ClientReading_9.speaker: Tiernan Wont
AD_ClientReading_9.text: I already have two copies of this...
AD_ClientReading_9.context: NodeContext: Dismissive of the book he's found

AD_ClientReading_8.speaker: Tiernan Wont
AD_ClientReading_8.text: Ugh, what's an issue of the Baldur's Mouth Gazette doing in here? And why is it damp?
AD_ClientReading_8.context: NodeContext: Disgusted at the damp newspaper

AD_ClientReading_5.speaker: Tiernan Wont
AD_ClientReading_5.text: Some people have no respect for literature!

AD_ClientReading_11.speaker: Tiernan Wont
AD_ClientReading_11.text: Into the bin where it belongs.

TolnaReactTomesStealAttempt_0.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
TolnaReactTomesStealAttempt_0.text: (You mustn't have heard me before: DO. NOT. TOUCH. THE TOMES.)
TolnaReactTomesStealAttempt_0.context: NodeContext: Harsh whisper; she's caught us stealing

TolnaReactTomesStealAttempt_1.speaker: Tolna Tome-Monger
TolnaReactTomesStealAttempt_1.text: (Those are rare magic tomes. No sneaky peeking!)
TolnaReactTomesStealAttempt_1.context: NodeContext: Harsh whisper; she's caught us stealing

NightsongPostAttack_27.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongPostAttack_27.text: Our camp has been besieged by bribelings. And Dame Aylin is the prize that seduced them.

NightsongPostAttack_12.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongPostAttack_12.text: I found a note on one of the foes - it read of the wizard Lorroakan and his designs upon my capture.

NightsongPostAttack_37.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongPostAttack_37.text: Tell me, ally mine: did you know of this plot?

NightsongPostAttack_13.speaker: Player
NightsongPostAttack_13.text: I would have told you if I'd known you were in trouble.

NightsongPostAttack_4.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongPostAttack_4.text: Your manners belie your words. There cannot be secrets betwixt us - not ones like this.

NightsongPostAttack_28.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongPostAttack_28.text: I wish to forgive this lapse in your fealty - for we must face the cad together.

NightsongPostAttack_33.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongPostAttack_33.text: I wish to forgive this lapse in your fealty, though it won't be the first. I pray I am not mistaken in my presumption of your good will.

NightsongPostAttack_36.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongPostAttack_36.text: Prove me right. Fight alongside me against a mad mage one more time.

NightsongPostAttack_20.speaker: Player
NightsongPostAttack_20.text: I knew Lorroakan wanted to capture you, yes.

NightsongPostAttack_8.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongPostAttack_8.text: You ought to have revealed this plot before. What if a hair on darling Isobel's head had been harmed?

NightsongPostAttack_31.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongPostAttack_31.text: But it is too late for 'why's and 'what if's. Now the conspiracy has been revealed.

NightsongPostAttack_19.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongPostAttack_19.text: To Ramazith's Tower they were meant to take me. Ho! Won't Lorroakan be surprised when Dame Aylin trounces him in his own citadel.

NightsongPostAttack_16.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongPostAttack_16.text: Let us hie us to his chambers, his lair, when morning breaks. We will see him undone in the style of the dead, unburied Ketheric Thorm.

NightsongPostAttack_11.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongPostAttack_11.text: You ought to have revealed this plot before; aye, I would have slept with both eyes open wide.

NightsongPostAttack_24.speaker: Player
NightsongPostAttack_24.text: I did. I should have told you.

NightsongPostAttack_34.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongPostAttack_34.text: There can be no doubt about it. But even Dame Aylin experiences lapses in her fine judgement.

NightsongPostAttack_35.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongPostAttack_35.text: Allies we are, and allies we remain, and we will unite us against the deviant plot of this mad mage.

NightsongPostAttack_23.speaker: Player
NightsongPostAttack_23.text: I'm just as surprised as you are.

NightsongPostAttack_22.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongPostAttack_22.text: A most unwelcome surprise. But we shan't be caught out again.

NightsongPostAttack_15.speaker: Player
NightsongPostAttack_15.text: Whatever Lorroakan's plot, we will find and destroy him.

NightsongPostAttack_29.speaker: Player
NightsongPostAttack_29.text: Don't count on me to track every vendetta you've accrued.

NightsongPostAttack_2.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongPostAttack_2.text: No - you'd be busy day and night if you took as your own the enemies of Me.

NightsongPostAttack_9.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongPostAttack_9.text: Still, allies we are, and allies we remain. Let us unite us against the deviant plot of this mad mage.

NightsongPostAttack_32.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongPostAttack_32.text: It was as you foretold: the villain Lorroakan seeks to retrieve me, body and soul.

NightsongPostAttack_17.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongPostAttack_17.text: I found a note on one of the foes - it read of the wizard Lorroakan, high up in Ramazith's Tower, and his designs upon my capture.

NightsongPostAttack_1.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongPostAttack_1.text: He may be a fool and a braggart, but it seems this Lorroakan is a toad of action, too.

NightsongPostAttack_25.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongPostAttack_25.text: Dame Aylin will face him. You will wield your glorious might at her side. Let us split him, crotch to crown, and let his twin halves fall where they may.

NightsongPostAttack_30.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongPostAttack_30.text: Finish your night's rest, then meet me in Ramazith's Tower. We will finish this together.

Rolan_8.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_8.text: Welcome to Sorcerous Sundries, where every item carries the personal guarantee of Lorroakan, Immortal Master of Ramazith's Tower. How can I help you?

Rolan_42.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_42.text: Of course - but Master Lorroakan has yet to share the fruits of our labour with me. Apparently I'm 'not ready'.
Rolan_42.context: NodeContext: slightly annoyed, emphasis on 'our'. Clearly unhappy.

Rolan_20.speaker: Player
Rolan_20.text: I'm surprised you're behind the counter, and not up in the tower.

Rolan_64.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_64.text: And this is where I shall stay, apparently. Immortality has not improved Master Lorroakan's temperament.

Rolan_0.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_0.text: It is, rather. Master Lorroakan has us keep it to a high standard.

Rolan_108.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_108.text: I'm his apprentice. In addition to attending to the shop, I'll one day enter his tutelage.

Rolan_16.speaker: Player
Rolan_16.text: That man outside seemed quite irate.

Rolan_69.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_69.text: Master Lorroakan has a contract out to any idiot with legs to find the Nightsong. Aradin is one such idiot.
Rolan_69.context: NodeContext: rolls eyes, snooty and condescending

Rolan_2.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_2.text: He's the most powerful wizard in Baldur's Gate. And I am his apprentice.
Rolan_2.context: NodeContext: A bit subdued and defeated while masking that with a normal cadence.

Rolan_100.speaker: Gale
Rolan_100.text: I've heard rumours about Lorroakan's 'teaching'. Or lack of it. His students are no more than glorified shopkeeps.

Rolan_96.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_96.text: You must be here to shop. I am sundries, while Tolna deals with tomes.
Rolan_96.context: NodeContext: A bit subdued and defeated while masking that with a normal cadence.

Rolan_131.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_131.text: Or... are you perhaps another 'adventurer' with information on the 'Nightsong'?
Rolan_131.context: NodeContext: A bit subdued and defeated while masking that with a normal cadence.

Rolan_79.speaker: Player
Rolan_79.text: I might be here about Nightsong.

Rolan_63.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_63.text: If you've got information, Master Lorroakan will want to speak to you immediately. He speaks of almost nothing else than the Nightsong's retrieval.

Rolan_32.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_32.text: Head upstairs to find the way into his tower. But be careful - mistakes are always punished around here.

Rolan_66.speaker: Player
Rolan_66.text: I know Nightsong, actually. Or did at least.

Rolan_116.speaker: Player
Rolan_116.text: Nightsong? She's in my camp right now.

Rolan_119.speaker: Player
Rolan_119.text: I have to ask - what happened to your face?

Rolan_89.speaker: Player
Rolan_89.text: You look familiar. Were you in the druid's grove?

Rolan_14.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_14.text: Perhaps. I stopped by many huts and hamlets on my way here. Master Lorroakan invited me to be his apprentice.
Rolan_14.context: NodeContext: A bit subdued and defeated while masking that with a normal cadence.

Rolan_49.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_49.context: NodeContext: looks up, sees player - utterly furious

Rolan_82.speaker: Player
Rolan_82.text: It's good to see you too, Rolan.

Rolan_48.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_48.text: Please, just make your purchase and go. I don't have energy for anything else.

Rolan_85.speaker: Player
Rolan_85.text: Let me see what's on offer.

Rolan_78.speaker: Player
Rolan_78.text: I want to speak to whoever's in charge around here.

Rolan_142.speaker: Player
Rolan_142.text: Gods, what happened to your face?

Rolan_88.speaker: Player
Rolan_88.text: I know the marks of subjugation. Your face - what happened?

Rolan_118.speaker: Player
Rolan_118.text: I know a beating when I see one. Who knocked you about?

Rolan_128.speaker: Player
Rolan_128.text: Rolan. How are you faring without Cal and Lia?

Rolan_143.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_143.text: Life goes on, doesn't it. Whether you want it to or not.

Rolan_57.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_57.context: NodeContext: looks up, sees player - utterly furious

Rolan_99.speaker: Player
Rolan_99.text: Calm down, Rolan. I'm not here for you.

Rolan_41.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_41.text: I should hope not. After you left Cal and Lia to die, I never want to see your face again.

Rolan_37.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_37.text: If you insist on making a purchase, hurry up and do it.

Rolan_109.speaker: Player
Rolan_109.text: Gods - what happened to your face?

Rolan_46.speaker: Player
Rolan_46.text: I know the marks of subjugation. Your face - what happened?

Rolan_22.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_22.context: NodeContext: player has asked what happened to rolan's face. He has to switch gears form furious, to defensive. Stuuters a little, looks away angrily.

Rolan_106.speaker: Narrator
Rolan_106.text: *His voice catches. There's more going on here than meets the eye.*

Rolan_87.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_87.text: You want to buy something? Buy it. Then get out.

Rolan_40.speaker: Player
Rolan_40.text: I'll see what you have on offer, then.

Rolan_136.speaker: Player
Rolan_136.text: I want to speak to whoever's in charge around here.

Rolan_139.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_139.text: Sure. Head on upstairs. Though do be warned, if you don't bring something called the 'Nightsong' with you, your head will be put through a window.

Rolan_125.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_125.text: I look forward to seeing it.

Rolan_26.speaker: Player
Rolan_26.text: Sorry, I'll leave you in peace.

Rolan_84.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_84.text: I have no peace - not anymore.

Rolan_101.speaker: Player
Rolan_101.text: I know a beating when I see one. Who knocked you about?

Rolan_17.speaker: Player
Rolan_17.text: Did you see Aradin outside? From the druid's grove?

Rolan_43.speaker: Player
Rolan_43.text: I know you're upset about Cal and Lia, but I didn't kill them.

Rolan_4.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_4.text: True enough. You didn't kill them - just left them to die in that godforsaken tower.

Rolan_107.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_107.context: NodeContext: last thing he wants, in the entire world, is to be speaking to the player right now

Rolan_34.speaker: Player
Rolan_34.text: I have information on the Nightsong. I want to speak to Lorroakan.

Rolan_67.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_67.text: Then head upstairs. And be careful - something terrible might happen if you're not paying attention.
Rolan_67.context: NodeContext: frustrated, doesn't want to be speaking to the player

Rolan_120.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_120.text: Welcome back. How can I assist?

Rolan_149.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_149.text: You. What are you doing here?
Rolan_149.context: NodeContext: looks up - sees player. Delighted

Rolan_30.speaker: Player
Rolan_30.text: Me? What are you doing here?

Rolan_60.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_60.text: It has not been what I expected. Master Lorroakan is... a difficult man.
Rolan_60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gently touches bruised face,NodeContext: Gently touches bruised face, distant

Rolan_112.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_112.text: He's consumed by his pursuit of the Nightsong. I haven't learnt a thing and I fear it'll stay that way.

Rolan_45.speaker: Gale
Rolan_45.text: A lucky escape, given Lorroakan's reputation. He'd have little of value to teach you.

Rolan_111.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_111.text: Lia suspected it might be this way. She was a pain, but she was always right.
Rolan_111.context: NodeContext: verklempt, thinking of his sister wistfully

Rolan_98.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_98.text: Cal thought this would be everything I wanted. He always was an optimist.
Rolan_98.context: NodeContext: verklempt, thinking of his sister wistfully

Rolan_39.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_39.text: But never mind that. What can I do for you?
Rolan_39.context: NodeContext: uncomofrtable, trying to be cheery and professional

Rolan_44.speaker: Player
Rolan_44.text: You look a bit worse for wear. What happened to your face?

Rolan_103.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_103.text: Nothing for you to worry about.
Rolan_103.context: NodeContext: player has asked about his face (master lorroakan hurt him, but he doesn't want to say).

Rolan_150.speaker: Player
Rolan_150.text: I know the marks of subjugation. Your face - what happened?

Rolan_113.speaker: Player
Rolan_113.text: I know a beating when I see one. Who knocked you about?

Rolan_52.speaker: Player
Rolan_52.text: Did you see Aradin outside? From the druid's grove?

Rolan_54.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_54.text: Aye. We had to remove him from the premises, but unfortunately we couldn't stop him from being a nuisance just outside.
Rolan_54.context: NodeContext: sigh, talking about aradin who caused hassle in the shop earlier

Rolan_127.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_127.text: Can't blame him for taking Lorroakan's contract to retrieve the Nightsong. There's a fortune on offer, and so far no one's been able to claim it.

Rolan_102.speaker: Player
Rolan_102.text: Do many people ask about the Nightsong?

Rolan_65.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_65.text: It's all I deal with these days - people claiming their trinkets are the 'real Nightsong', looking for the mountain of gold Lorroakan promised.
Rolan_65.context: NodeContext: annoyed, rolling eyes - thinks the nightsong is a wild goosechase

Rolan_12.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_12.text: There's even a pamphlet. Take one - they're on the desk.
Rolan_12.context: NodeContext: gestures directly in front of him - to the counter

Rolan_148.speaker: Player
Rolan_148.text: I have information on the Nightsong.

Rolan_25.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_25.text: Be very sure before you make to visit Lorroakan. He's got a beastly temper.
Rolan_25.context: NodeContext: sounds a little dissapointed in the player

Rolan_76.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_76.text: But if you really do know something, he'll want to see you. Head upstairs - you can find the way into his tower up there.

Rolan_83.speaker: Player
Rolan_83.text: Nightsong? She's in my camp right now.

Rolan_145.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_145.text: You must be mistaken. The Nightsong is a relic - something quite ancient, to hear Master Lorroakan talk.
Rolan_145.context: NodeContext: surprised, can't believe the nightsong is a person, and that she's with payer

Rolan_135.speaker: Player
Rolan_135.text: I know Nightsong, actually. Or knew her, at least.

Rolan_35.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_35.text: I suppose that, at least, I can help with.

Rolan_71.speaker: Rolan
Rolan_71.text: Hope you found what you're looking for.
Rolan_71.context: NodeContext: A little defeated but still cheerful

Rolan_53.speaker: Player
Rolan_53.text: I heard this was the place for spellcasting prodigies - why are you here?

Rolan_27.speaker: Player
Rolan_27.text: I'm here for sorcerous sundries, of course.

AD_GuardianWrongPortal_0.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
AD_GuardianWrongPortal_0.text: For your own personal safety, it is ill-advised to waste Master Lorroakan's time.

WaterElemental_0.speaker: Narrator
WaterElemental_0.text: *The water elemental appears to turn towards you, showering everything with a bracing mist.*

WaterElemental_1.speaker: Narrator
WaterElemental_1.text: *The water elemental's form shivers before you, a damp patina dripping off your skin.*

FireElemental_11.speaker: Narrator
FireElemental_11.text: *The lava elemental looks at you placidly, near unfathomable heat beating against your face.*

FireElemental_12.speaker: Narrator
FireElemental_12.text: *The lava elemental stares back at you. As your eyelashes start to singe, you realise this is what it's been like for people facing your infernal heat.*

FireElemental_13.speaker: Narrator
FireElemental_13.text: *The lava elemental stares back at you - you think you can feel your eyelashes starting to singe.*

FireElemental_22.speaker: Narrator
FireElemental_22.text: *The lava elemental looks at you placidly. For the first time since you've had your infernal heart, you've met something even hotter than you.*

FireElemental_2.speaker: Narrator
FireElemental_2.text: *The elemental stares back. It is not an invitation.*

FireElemental_0.speaker: Player
FireElemental_0.text: I'll keep my distance. Happy blazing.

FireElemental_4.speaker: Player
FireElemental_4.text: Where did you come from, big boy?

FireElemental_10.speaker: Narrator
FireElemental_10.text: *The elemental shudders slightly, but you don't get its meaning.*

FireElemental_21.speaker: Player
FireElemental_21.text: Not one for many words, I see.

FireElemental_15.speaker: Player
FireElemental_15.text: Well. Welcome to Baldur's Gate in any case.

FireElemental_17.speaker: Narrator
FireElemental_17.text: *You sense an unfathomable depth behind the shifting crevices of its face. A pleasant heat passes through you.*

PAD_ExploringVault_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ExploringVault_0.text: Wonder if there's anything interesting we might... borrow.

FinalConfrontation_121.speaker: Nightsong
FinalConfrontation_121.text: What have we here? A magician in a tower, hiding away from the frightening world.
FinalConfrontation_121.context: NodeContext: Disdain; she hates this wizard

FinalConfrontation_116.speaker: Nightsong
FinalConfrontation_116.text: What are you so scared of, magus? Not the Nightsong, surely - why, she's nothing but a relic to be purchased and pursued.

FinalConfrontation_13.speaker: Rolan
FinalConfrontation_13.text: My gods! The Nightsong is a person?
FinalConfrontation_13.context: NodeContext: Under his breath. He's shocked, but he's not the star of this scene. This is an aside.

FinalConfrontation_45.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_45.text: At last. There you are, my dear.

FinalConfrontation_14.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_14.text: By my honour! It's you! My dear, I thought you were -
FinalConfrontation_14.context: NodeContext: Surprised; player previously convinced him she was dead

FinalConfrontation_90.speaker: Nightsong
FinalConfrontation_90.text: You will address me with due deference. I am Dame Aylin. And you are a whelp without honour, without pride, with nothing but a tower full of trinkets.

FinalConfrontation_2.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_2.text: My apologies, Dame Aylin. I meant no disrespect. I asked our mutual friend here to make an introduction that I might get to meet the famed daughter of Selûne.
FinalConfrontation_2.context: NodeContext: With quite an edge; he has dark plans for her.

FinalConfrontation_117.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_117.text: Our friend told me you had died. I am most pleased to see that isn't true. A whimsical misunderstanding, I'm sure.
FinalConfrontation_117.context: NodeContext: With chagrin and suspicion, though barely keeping his veneer of civility

FinalConfrontation_80.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_80.text: Perhaps they can bridge the gap and do what I believe they came here to do.
FinalConfrontation_80.context: NodeContext: Suggestive - the subtext being "let's start the attack"

FinalConfrontation_122.speaker: Player
FinalConfrontation_122.text: I came to stop you, Lorroakan.

FinalConfrontation_54.speaker: Nightsong
FinalConfrontation_54.text: My steel-hearted friend speaks true. Give me one good reason, magus, why I should not strike you down where you stand.

FinalConfrontation_1.speaker: Player
FinalConfrontation_1.text: I have more magic in my little finger than you do in this entire tower. You cannot stop us both.

FinalConfrontation_44.speaker: Player
FinalConfrontation_44.text: It's over for you, wizard. You can't overpower both of us.

FinalConfrontation_87.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_87.text: Tut. A pity you didn't prove a more reliable ally. You could've reaped the rewards of my good favour.

FinalConfrontation_99.speaker: Nightsong
FinalConfrontation_99.text: Do not play; do not jest. We have come to square off against an enemy most loathsome.

FinalConfrontation_40.speaker: Nightsong
FinalConfrontation_40.text: So speak, O loathsome one. Give me one good reason why I should not cave your head into your neck.

FinalConfrontation_20.speaker: Player
FinalConfrontation_20.text: This will be much easier if you go quietly, Aylin.

FinalConfrontation_4.speaker: Nightsong
FinalConfrontation_4.text: Dame Aylin does not go anywhere quietly.
FinalConfrontation_4.context: NodeContext: Stiffening, realizing she's going to need to fight off her enemies AND her ally

FinalConfrontation_85.speaker: Rolan
FinalConfrontation_85.text: Be reasonable, madame. You can't outmatch two powerful wizards.

FinalConfrontation_57.speaker: Nightsong
FinalConfrontation_57.text: There is nothing I cannot do.

FinalConfrontation_9.speaker: Nightsong
FinalConfrontation_9.text: This will be the last time you betray My Majesty. Today, I will end your life. End it for once and for all.

FinalConfrontation_5.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_5.text: Ah, Aylin, I look forward to getting to know you for the next eternity.

FinalConfrontation_128.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_128.context: NodeContext: Right before battle; hatred dripping from his words. He is getting ready to summon Myrmidons to fight for him, but this will happen in gameplay, not cine

FinalConfrontation_27.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_27.text: Forgive me for that impudence. Perhaps our friend can bridge the gap, and do what I believe they came here to do.
FinalConfrontation_27.context: NodeContext: Suggestive - the subtext being "let's start the attack"

FinalConfrontation_118.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_118.text: My apologies, Dame Aylin. I meant no disrespect.
FinalConfrontation_118.context: NodeContext: With quite an edge; he has dark plans for her.

FinalConfrontation_102.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_102.text: Perhaps we could start over. I am Lorroakan. I am most pleased to make your acquaintance. And that of your fine companion, who perhaps heard I was looking for you.
FinalConfrontation_102.context: NodeContext: With quite an edge; he has dark plans for her.

FinalConfrontation_79.speaker: Player
FinalConfrontation_79.text: You've offered a huge sum to whoever brings you the Nightsong. Explain why.

FinalConfrontation_113.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_113.text: Dame Aylin, I have discovered a device that would allow your immortality to be shared. It would cause you no harm, no pain of any kind.

FinalConfrontation_88.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_88.text: You serve your mother Selûne, I believe. She who has blessed our realm with so many gifts. Honour her by sharing yours.

FinalConfrontation_101.speaker: Nightsong
FinalConfrontation_101.text: You do not seek to share my gifts. You seek to poach them.

FinalConfrontation_89.speaker: Nightsong
FinalConfrontation_89.text: You dare to threaten me with the same magic that held me in torment for a hundred years.
FinalConfrontation_89.context: NodeContext: Slightly in disbelief at his foolishness

FinalConfrontation_19.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_19.text: I had hoped to appeal to your better nature. Perhaps I overestimated you. No bother. I have an arsenal of implements capable of convincing you to see reason.

FinalConfrontation_75.speaker: Gale
FinalConfrontation_75.text: They say madness and genius are separated by but a hair's breadth. Perhaps the same is true of madness and stupidity.

FinalConfrontation_115.speaker: Player
FinalConfrontation_115.text: A man named Ketheric Thorm already tried stealing Nightsong's immortality. He's dead now.

FinalConfrontation_28.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_28.text: I'd hoped you'd keep an open mind, but it seems you're determined to make this as difficult as possible.

FinalConfrontation_78.speaker: Rolan
FinalConfrontation_78.text: Master, let us show these amateurs the price they pay for challenging real wizards.

FinalConfrontation_0.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_0.text: Boy! At the ready. Once I've taken control of the aasimar, she must go directly into the caging runes.

FinalConfrontation_22.speaker: Rolan
FinalConfrontation_22.text: No, Master Lorroakan. I would never have assisted you if I knew you planned such horrors.

FinalConfrontation_67.speaker: Rolan
FinalConfrontation_67.text: You lied to get the Nightsong here. Made us all believe she was nothing but a relic. I have seen what true leadership can accomplish - but never under your tutelage.
FinalConfrontation_67.context: NodeContext: Nods to the player for 'true leadership'. This is a compliment to the player and a slight to Lorroak

FinalConfrontation_15.speaker: Rolan
FinalConfrontation_15.text: My magic is yours to command, Master Lorroakan. Simply say the word.

FinalConfrontation_47.speaker: Rolan
FinalConfrontation_47.text: Look, you need to stop this - please. Just hand her - hand the Nightsong over.

FinalConfrontation_18.speaker: Player
FinalConfrontation_18.text: You're smarter than this, Rolan - don't make me kill you.

FinalConfrontation_58.speaker: Rolan
FinalConfrontation_58.text: If this came to blows, Lia would never forgive me. Cal is only alive because of you.

FinalConfrontation_30.speaker: Rolan
FinalConfrontation_30.text: Consider this my formal resignation, Lorroakan.

FinalConfrontation_91.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_91.text: Watch your tongue, you child! I could make it such that no wizard in the realm will touch you.

FinalConfrontation_33.speaker: Rolan
FinalConfrontation_33.text: If they're all like you, I think that sounds like an excellent bargain.

FinalConfrontation_111.speaker: Nightsong
FinalConfrontation_111.text: Ho! Face us, charlatan. We who detest you so.
FinalConfrontation_111.context: NodeContext: With excitement/ a laugh - she gets to fight Lorroakan now

FinalConfrontation_65.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_65.context: NodeContext: Right before battle; hatred dripping from his words. He is getting ready to summon Myrmidons to fight for him, but this will happen in gameplay, not cine

FinalConfrontation_107.speaker: Rolan
FinalConfrontation_107.text: If this came to blows, Cal would never forgive me. Lia is only alive because of you.

FinalConfrontation_84.speaker: Rolan
FinalConfrontation_84.text: You leave me no choice. Lorroakan is my master - I owe him my fealty.

FinalConfrontation_51.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_51.text: I have great plans for you, Dame Aylin. And if you will not go quietly, then you'll go kicking and screaming.

FinalConfrontation_114.speaker: Nightsong
FinalConfrontation_114.text: Magicians and their plans for Dame Aylin. Predictable; sadistic; flaccid.
FinalConfrontation_114.context: NodeContext: With a little laugh on the first bit. (This precedes 'You wont' be laughing for long' from Lorroakan)

FinalConfrontation_66.speaker: Player
FinalConfrontation_66.text: Don't ally yourself with a monster, Rolan. Not after all you've suffered.

FinalConfrontation_35.speaker: Rolan
FinalConfrontation_35.text: Ugh. One more hurdle on my path to greatness: a conscience.

FinalConfrontation_7.speaker: Rolan
FinalConfrontation_7.text: And haven't I suffered enough? Hasn't the road here been almost as hellish as the Hells we were sent to?

FinalConfrontation_59.speaker: Rolan
FinalConfrontation_59.text: Master Lorroakan will lead me to my destiny. A destiny I deserve. My magic is yours, master - say the word.

FinalConfrontation_71.speaker: Player
FinalConfrontation_71.text: Lorroakan's magic is tainted, Rolan. You can do better.

FinalConfrontation_17.speaker: Rolan
FinalConfrontation_17.text: It would be nice to have a mentor who actually taught me magic. Or was competent.

FinalConfrontation_42.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_42.text: Choose your next words very carefully, apprentice. I do not suffer insubordination.

FinalConfrontation_126.speaker: Rolan
FinalConfrontation_126.text: And I don't suffer fools, Lorroakan.

FinalConfrontation_56.speaker: Rolan
FinalConfrontation_56.text: You're wrong. I'm exactly where I need to be.

FinalConfrontation_64.speaker: Player
FinalConfrontation_64.text: You are twice the wizard Lorroakan is. Don't do this.

FinalConfrontation_61.speaker: Rolan
FinalConfrontation_61.text: I am, aren't I? And I most certainly shouldn't spend my days dusting scrolls I'm not allowed to read.

FinalConfrontation_123.speaker: Player
FinalConfrontation_123.text: I know what it is to be tempted by power. Don't repeat my mistakes.

FinalConfrontation_34.speaker: Player
FinalConfrontation_34.text: Come now, Rolan. If a wizard wants power, they have to take it.

FinalConfrontation_24.speaker: Rolan
FinalConfrontation_24.text: You saved my sister, so I wanted to show you kindness. But I suppose we're past that now.

FinalConfrontation_26.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_26.text: A pity - but let it be said that we tried to be reasonable. Dame Aylin, if you will not go quietly, then you'll go kicking and screaming.

FinalConfrontation_72.speaker: Rolan
FinalConfrontation_72.text: You saved my brother, so I wanted to show you kindness. But I suppose we're past that now.

FinalConfrontation_83.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_83.context: NodeContext: Right before battle; hatred dripping from his words. He is getting ready to summon Myrmidons to fight for him, but this will happen in gameplay, not cine

FinalConfrontation_110.speaker: Player
FinalConfrontation_110.text: Enough. One more word about this, and it'll be your last.

FinalConfrontation_41.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_41.text: You think I'll watch my life's work falter so easily? Now that the device is in my hands, and the Nightsong is at my fingertips?

FinalConfrontation_109.speaker: Player
FinalConfrontation_109.text: You can have the immortal, Lorroakan. But I expect a fine reward in return.

FinalConfrontation_76.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_76.text: And you shall have it. This I promise you.

FinalConfrontation_25.speaker: Nightsong
FinalConfrontation_25.text: Traitor! I will bring this tower to the ground before I'll hear another word.

FinalConfrontation_6.speaker: Player
FinalConfrontation_6.text: Reconsider your position, Lorroakan. Nothing can hold the daughter of Selûne in perpetuity.

FinalConfrontation_129.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_129.text: You aren't the first to underestimate me, Gale of Waterdeep. But you may well be the last.

FinalConfrontation_8.speaker: Player
FinalConfrontation_8.text: Aylin, I don't trust this. We should go.

FinalConfrontation_23.speaker: Nightsong
FinalConfrontation_23.text: Go? So that this magus might send his jesters to harangue me night and day?

FinalConfrontation_86.speaker: Nightsong
FinalConfrontation_86.text: No. We have come for answers. And, if needed, heads.

FinalConfrontation_16.speaker: Lorroakan
FinalConfrontation_16.text: It is mine, I assure you. Perhaps I ought to explain why I went to such tremendous lengths to find you.

AD_RolanWithoutLorroakanAfterCombat_0.speaker: Rolan
AD_RolanWithoutLorroakanAfterCombat_0.text: He's dead. My gods, he's really dead.

Client005_0.speaker: Hector Roba
Client005_0.text: I'm not moving from this spot until Lorroakan comes and speaks to me personally. I will be heard!

Client005_1.speaker: Hector Roba
Client005_1.text: Where is the famous Lorroakan? His shop is an utter shambles!

AD_RamazithTowerNoGale_4.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_RamazithTowerNoGale_4.text: I should fetch Gale. He'd want to set eyes on these relics.

AD_RamazithTowerNoGale_8.speaker: Shadowheart
AD_RamazithTowerNoGale_8.text: Pity Gale isn't here. This is just his sort of place.

AD_RamazithTowerNoGale_9.speaker: Astarion
AD_RamazithTowerNoGale_9.text: Oh, look at this place! Gale would be salivating.

AD_RamazithTowerNoGale_5.speaker: Wyll
AD_RamazithTowerNoGale_5.text: Magical relics galore. Seems like Gale's type of place.

AD_RamazithTowerNoGale_3.speaker: Karlach
AD_RamazithTowerNoGale_3.text: All this magical hoo-ha. Gale would love it here.

AD_RamazithTowerNoGale_11.speaker: Halsin
AD_RamazithTowerNoGale_11.text: A sight to behold. If only we had Gale with us.

AD_RamazithTowerNoGale_0.speaker: Jaheira
AD_RamazithTowerNoGale_0.text: Shelves stuffed with overpriced arcane trinkets. This place would whet Gale's appetite something fearsome.

AD_RamazithTowerNoGale_10.speaker: Minsc
AD_RamazithTowerNoGale_10.text: Ah, Sorcerous Sundries. Gale would be giddy as a wizard in a magic shop.

AD_AradinYellingAtKlank_0.speaker: Aradin
AD_AradinYellingAtKlank_0.text: Get this tin pisspot out of my face.
AD_AradinYellingAtKlank_0.context: NodeContext: ARadin is talking to Klank, the animated armour guarding the shop, but is really addressing Lorroakan, who isn't present. He's standing in front of the shop, yelling.

AD_AradinYellingAtKlank_1.speaker: Aradin
AD_AradinYellingAtKlank_1.context: NodeContext: ARadin is talking to Klank, the animated armour guarding the shop, but is really addressing Lorroakan, who isn't present. He's standing in front of the shop, yelling.

AD_AradinYellingAtKlank_2.speaker: Aradin
AD_AradinYellingAtKlank_2.text: You gonna face me like a man or hide away like a child?
AD_AradinYellingAtKlank_2.context: NodeContext: ARadin is talking to Klank, the animated armour guarding the shop, but is really addressing Lorroakan, who isn't present. He's standing in front of the shop, yelling.

AD_AradinYellingAtKlank_3.speaker: Aradin
AD_AradinYellingAtKlank_3.text: Come out or I'll have to come find you, Lorroakan.
AD_AradinYellingAtKlank_3.context: NodeContext: ARadin is talking to Klank, the animated armour guarding the shop, but is really addressing Lorroakan, who isn't present. He's standing in front of the shop, yelling.

AD_CoupleBuying_3.speaker: Lester Farrower
AD_CoupleBuying_3.text: We really should've planted that herb garden, you know.

AD_CoupleBuying_0.speaker: Shuna Huanje
AD_CoupleBuying_0.text: Ah, well, it's too late for that now, isn't it, dear?

AD_CoupleBuying_1.speaker: Shuna Huanje
AD_CoupleBuying_1.text: We might have a bit of that catnip decoction left - as long as Lord Pawtash hasn't gotten into it.

AD_CoupleBuying_9.speaker: Lester Farrower
AD_CoupleBuying_9.text: I really wish you hadn't called the cat that. It feels a little... improper?

AD_CoupleBuying_6.speaker: Shuna Huanje
AD_CoupleBuying_6.text: Impropriety's the least of our worries with that mad cult on our doorstep.

AD_CoupleBuying_4.speaker: Lester Farrower
AD_CoupleBuying_4.text: I just think we should be careful what we say in public, is all.

AD_CoupleBuying_11.speaker: Shuna Huanje
AD_CoupleBuying_11.context: NodeContext: Figuring out what she has in her basket, as it were

AD_CoupleBuying_10.speaker: Shuna Huanje
AD_CoupleBuying_10.text: Six handfuls of assorted mushrooms. You can never have too many mushrooms.
AD_CoupleBuying_10.context: NodeContext: Pleased with this turn of events - she likes mushrooms

AD_CoupleBuying_2.speaker: Lester Farrower
AD_CoupleBuying_2.text: Perhaps we ought to ask what they have in the back? If anything...

AD_CoupleBuying_14.speaker: Shuna Huanje
AD_CoupleBuying_14.text: I don't think it'd hurt - they'll probably have even less tomorrow.

AD_CoupleBuying_12.speaker: Lester Farrower
AD_CoupleBuying_12.text: Madness. Utter madness. Next they'll start panic-buying parchment!

AD_CoupleBuying_7.speaker: Lester Farrower
AD_CoupleBuying_7.text: Gods, the shelves are practically picked bare.

AD_CoupleBuying_17.speaker: Lester Farrower
AD_CoupleBuying_17.text: Bloodstaunch, jewelweed, mothersleaf - all gone. Typical.
AD_CoupleBuying_17.context: NodeContext: Reeling off a list in exasperation; it's all gone

AD_CoupleBuying_13.speaker: Lester Farrower
AD_CoupleBuying_13.text: Not everyone can just wave their hands and be healed. Why aren't they rationing anything?

AD_CoupleBuying_8.speaker: Shuna Huanje
AD_CoupleBuying_8.text: Gold. It's all about profits, my love.

AD_CoupleBuying_16.speaker: Lester Farrower
AD_CoupleBuying_16.text: It certainly is at that - but what'll we do in the meantime?

PAD_AlarmPerceptionSucceeded_0.speaker: Player
PAD_AlarmPerceptionSucceeded_0.text: Careful. This thing's warded with a magic spell.

Client002_0.speaker: Shuna Huanje
Client002_0.text: Still here? I'll have you know my elbows are much sharper than yours - don't start a jostle you can't finish.

Client002_1.speaker: Shuna Huanje
Client002_1.text: Would you mind if I finished browsing before you muscle in, please? I was here first, actually.
Client002_1.context: NodeContext: Trying to be polite about hogging the shelves - TRYING

PAD_BoughtKarsusBook_0.speaker: Player
PAD_BoughtKarsusBook_0.text: Hm. A book on Netherese magic. Gale may like to know.

IsobelCamp_5.speaker: Isobel
IsobelCamp_5.text: Aylin left to face that wizard - Lorroakan, was it?

IsobelCamp_9.speaker: Isobel
IsobelCamp_9.text: Even after all she's been through, she thinks herself unstoppable - invincible.

IsobelCamp_6.speaker: Isobel
IsobelCamp_6.text: It all feels like recklessness to me.

IsobelCamp_14.speaker: Player
IsobelCamp_14.text: Lorroakan can't harm her. Have faith.

IsobelCamp_27.speaker: Isobel
IsobelCamp_27.text: He can harm her. Just as Ketheric did. She'll survive it, but she can suffer like any of us - and for longer.

IsobelCamp_7.speaker: Player
IsobelCamp_7.text: She's reckless but powerful. Lorroakan is probably already dead.

IsobelCamp_10.speaker: Isobel
IsobelCamp_10.text: I hope you're right. He sounds like a vile, vile man. I'd have liked to get a few licks in myself, honestly.

IsobelCamp_20.speaker: Isobel
IsobelCamp_20.text: I wanted to help her, but she said she fights better when she knows I'm safe. I understand, I suppose - I feel the same about her.

IsobelCamp_4.speaker: Player
IsobelCamp_4.text: I'm going to help her in the fight against Lorroakan.

IsobelCamp_16.speaker: Isobel
IsobelCamp_16.text: I'll rest a little easier if you do. You fought well against my father. I imagine a rat like Lorroakan will be nothing in comparison.

IsobelCamp_19.speaker: Player
IsobelCamp_19.text: She can take care of herself. She's Dame Aylin, remember?

IsobelCamp_26.speaker: Isobel
IsobelCamp_26.text: She certainly is. And she always will be, won't she? Gods, I miss her already.

IsobelCamp_0.speaker: Player
IsobelCamp_0.text: You're right. Her temper will get the better of her.

IsobelCamp_12.speaker: Isobel
IsobelCamp_12.text: Aylin seems a little subdued since you came back. Did something happen?

IsobelCamp_28.speaker: Player
IsobelCamp_28.text: The usual mayhem. Maybe she's just tired.

IsobelCamp_24.speaker: Isobel
IsobelCamp_24.text: I've never known Aylin to slow down. Particularly not after a battle.

IsobelCamp_11.speaker: Player
IsobelCamp_11.text: I noticed she seemed a little unlike herself by the battle's end.

IsobelCamp_21.speaker: Isobel
IsobelCamp_21.text: You should've seen her before... before everything. When she'd step off the battlefield, oh how she glowed. Literally.

IsobelCamp_22.speaker: Isobel
IsobelCamp_22.text: But the years - the decades, the century - have taken their toll. She's seen more hurt than we can dream of.

IsobelCamp_25.speaker: Isobel
IsobelCamp_25.text: She needs cherishing, now. And I'm up for the task.

IsobelCamp_18.speaker: Player
IsobelCamp_18.text: I suppose she's tired of power-hungry mages trying to steal her immortality.

IsobelCamp_3.speaker: Isobel
IsobelCamp_3.text: It's not a problem most of us have.

IsobelCamp_15.speaker: Isobel
IsobelCamp_15.text: My poor darling. She's singular among us all.

IsobelCamp_8.speaker: Isobel
IsobelCamp_8.text: Thank you for fighting by her side. It means more to her - to me - than you know.

IsobelCamp_2.speaker: Player
IsobelCamp_2.text: She's been through a lot. Give her time.

IsobelCamp_13.speaker: Isobel
IsobelCamp_13.text: She has. But 'time' means something different to Aylin than you or I. She once went for a walk and didn't come back for a month. Couldn't understand why I was upset, either.
IsobelCamp_13.context: NodeContext: She is worried, but she says this with humour, too. She understands Aylin.

IsobelCamp_23.speaker: Isobel
IsobelCamp_23.text: Moonmaiden, hear me: protect the woman we both love so very dearly...

AD_LorroakanProjectionPuzzle_0.speaker: Lorroakan's Projection
AD_LorroakanProjectionPuzzle_0.text: If you wish to see the master, you must prove you bring first-hand knowledge of the Nightsong.

RolanWarning_2.speaker: Rolan
RolanWarning_2.text: Sorry, but you're not allowed back in here. I'm afraid my hands are tied.

RolanWarning_4.speaker: Rolan
RolanWarning_4.text: Take one more step in this establishment, and it'll be the last thing you do.

RolanWarning_1.speaker: Player
RolanWarning_1.text: Please, Rolan. Can't you make an exception?

RolanWarning_6.speaker: Rolan
RolanWarning_6.text: I wish I could, but this is Lorroakan's shop. He makes the rules.

RolanWarning_3.speaker: Rolan
RolanWarning_3.text: You leave me no choice. It's been an honour - but now it's over.

RolanWarning_8.speaker: Rolan
RolanWarning_8.text: That animated armour belongs to Lorroakan personally. Touch it again, and I'll have to stop you by any means necessary.

RolanProjection_5.speaker: Rolan's Projection
RolanProjection_5.text: Thank you for visiting Sorcerous Sundries.

RolanProjection_7.speaker: Rolan's Projection
RolanProjection_7.text: Let me introduce myself - I am Rolan, the new ruler of Ramazith's Tower. All deals and sales made under previous ownership will be honoured.
RolanProjection_7.context: NodeContext: he's a projection, gesturing to himself

RolanProjection_8.speaker: Rolan's Projection
RolanProjection_8.text: I hope you enjoy this curated selection of goods for all your magical needs.

RolanProjection_10.speaker: Rolan's Projection
RolanProjection_10.text: Of course - you're a valued customer.

RolanProjection_3.speaker: Player
RolanProjection_3.text: Pull a face at the projection.

RolanProjection_2.speaker: Rolan's Projection
RolanProjection_2.text: I didn't quite catch that - what did you say?

NecromancerVendor_0.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
NecromancerVendor_0.text: Look, I'm sure there's somebody else who can help you - I need to work while the flesh is fresh.
NecromancerVendor_0.context: NodeContext: Slightly irritated at being interrupted

NecromancerVendor_1.speaker: Cordrane the Recent
NecromancerVendor_1.text: Apologies - I'm with a customer at the moment.
NecromancerVendor_1.context: NodeContext: Slightly irritated at being interrupted

Lorroakan_3.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_3.text: Hold very still, Miklaur - Krank's aim is much improved but still leaves something up to chance.
Lorroakan_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Lorroakan has an animated armour shooting an apple off a halfling's head The halfing is trembling in fear as Lorroakan directs the armour.NodeContext: [Wilson] for this line, make sure the 1st pose is exactly the same as HUM_M_Rig_SCENE_LOW_SorcerousSundries_Lorroakan_DirectArmour (ends at 8s)

Lorroakan_218.speaker: Miklaur
Lorroakan_218.context: CinematicNodeContext: [scene] Krank is trying to balance an apple on his headNodeContext: Terrified - voice trembling.

Lorroakan_180.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_180.context: CinematicNodeContext: [scene] The animated armour raises the bow and aims it at the halfling's head, drawing the string.NodeContext: [Wilson] on Lorrokan part, would want him to have a gesture on his left hand when he says"Krank ready, aim" and hold the last pose sligtly longer around 2 beats.

Lorroakan_76.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_76.text: Hm. We have a visitor. At ease. Miklaur - you may go.
Lorroakan_76.context:
CinematicNodeContext: [scene] He gestures for the armour to lower the bow and for the halfling to leave. Krank lowers bow, Micklaur leaves.NodeContext: Spots player and sours instantly. 
[Wilson] On Lorrokan part, at the very start have him hold like a beat then proceed with the line.

Lorroakan_207.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_207.text: I see no Nightsong. Surely you wouldn't have entered my tower without the Nightsong in hand. Surely you wouldn't have wasted my time.

Lorroakan_127.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_127.text: So you're the great wizard Lorroakan? I see your reputation is well earned...

Lorroakan_187.speaker: Narrator
Lorroakan_187.text: *Barely a breath of confusion, before he sees you through your borrowed guise.*

Lorroakan_96.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_96.text: My - could it be? Gale of Waterdeep, here in my tower. I'm surprised you dare show your face after Mystra cast you on the scrap heap.

Lorroakan_44.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_44.text: Well don't stand on ceremony - out with it.

Lorroakan_24.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_24.text: I seek a certain rare tome - concerning Karsus.

Lorroakan_239.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_239.text: You're quite in luck, then - see Tolna downstairs. One such tome is amongst our rarest books.

Lorroakan_120.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_120.text: I acquired the 'The Annals of Karsus' from your bookseller. Did anything strike you as... unusual?

Lorroakan_176.speaker: Lorroakan
