Lorroakan_176.text: No more so than the rest of the volatile tomes in Tolna's collection. I had her keep them under lock and key to avoid any mishaps.

Lorroakan_140.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_140.text: Netherese magic - could it be that a source of it - a significant source - still exists?

Lorroakan_66.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_66.text: Impossible, I daresay. Something so... unstable can scarcely exist as anything greater than a minute fragment.

Lorroakan_39.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_39.text: Karsus found that out the hard way, and those wonderful flying cities of yore were grounded in a most violent manner. His hubris undid him.

Lorroakan_179.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_179.text: But enough of dusty history - I look to the future.

Lorroakan_22.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_22.text: You know I seek the Nightsong. Do you have it or not?

Lorroakan_274.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_274.text: What do you want with her?

Lorroakan_250.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_250.text: 'She'. Then you do know her. You've been to Shar's temple. To the Shadowfell. You've looked upon the Nightsong's face.

Lorroakan_168.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_168.text: Tell me - and choose your next words carefully - where is she now?

Lorroakan_283.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_283.text: She left after I freed her from Ketheric's thrall. I don't know where she is.

Lorroakan_281.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_281.text: Be careful what you wish for. She'll eat you alive.

Lorroakan_78.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_78.text: Why do you want her so badly?

Lorroakan_231.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_231.text: I'm growing tired of this repartee, my friend. Let us cut to the chase.

Lorroakan_58.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_58.text: Beautiful, isn't it? Worth more than your life, too. I bought it from a Calishite warlock with very little of his soul left to him.
Lorroakan_58.context: CinematicNodeContext: |He pulls out a wand and raises it for the player to admire.

Lorroakan_184.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_184.text: It can bind a celestial to the wearer's service with a snap of the fingers.

Lorroakan_278.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_278.text: And this? This can keep her in place. Forever.
Lorroakan_278.context: CinematicNodeContext: He gestures to the spell circle on the ground - same as the one Ketheric used used to bind Nightsong in Act 2

Lorroakan_202.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_202.text: I'll tell her to come here - just to give her the satisfaction of ripping you to shreds.

Lorroakan_86.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_86.text: A clever contraption. Let me guess: like Ketheric Thorm before you, you wish to become immortal.

Lorroakan_62.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_62.text: It didn't work out for poor Ketheric, did it? He was a fool. A desperate mercenary who whored out his soul to whichever god flattered him.

Lorroakan_77.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_77.text: I serve no god but that which stares back at me in the mirror.

Lorroakan_121.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_121.text: The Nightsong will be put to a grand purpose: equalising man and god. Whoever helps me attain that which I seek will be greatly rewarded.

Lorroakan_253.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_253.text: There is more to divinity than lifespan. Ensnaring an immortal won't make you a god.

Lorroakan_222.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_222.text: Of course not. But perhaps, after enough lifetimes, I might make a start of it.

Lorroakan_194.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_194.text: 'Equalising man and god'. Quite the lofty ambition.

Lorroakan_242.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_242.text: I intend to achieve greatness. And I intend to do it for a long, long, long time.

Lorroakan_195.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_195.text: I've always dreamt of immortality. Your plan is quite clever.

Lorroakan_269.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_269.text: 'Clever' doesn't begin to describe it. What I seek is the greatest ambition possible: to defy the ultimate limitation, transcend the fate that awaits us all.

Lorroakan_282.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_282.text: When I succeed, I may look favourably upon you. If you are a friend along the way, that is.

Lorroakan_177.speaker: Gale
Lorroakan_177.text: He would seek the power of gods for the pettiest of reasons - his own gratification. At least I seek them for the better of all.
Lorroakan_177.context: NodeContext: Discreet murmur to the player.

Lorroakan_51.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_51.text: What's that? I didn't quite catch the words, but the insolent tone was clear enough.
Lorroakan_51.context: NodeContext: Mockingly - he doesn't believe Gale for an instant

Lorroakan_173.speaker: Gale
Lorroakan_173.text: Pitying, not insolent. You chase one power without knowing an even greater one lies within my reach - the Crown of Karsus.

Lorroakan_115.speaker: Gale
Lorroakan_115.text: Once we acquire it, your ambitions will be dwarfed. I will be able to stand against Mystra, and wrest her powers from her. For the betterment of all.

Lorroakan_52.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_52.text: The Crown of Karsus? Nonsense - even if it still existed, you couldn't possibly handle its power -

Lorroakan_224.speaker: Gale
Lorroakan_224.text: Perhaps you could not. But Netheril's power is in my blood, and Mystra? I know her in ways that most mortals can only dream of.

Lorroakan_273.speaker: Narrator
Lorroakan_273.text: *There is only one man who would make such a brazen claim about Mystra. His suspicions confirmed, Lorroakan's curiosity settles into a sneer - this is Gale of Waterdeep. However else he might appear.*

Lorroakan_93.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_93.text: Ah. So it is you. Mystra's discarded lapdog. And now you think your bark is cause to make me tremble.

Lorroakan_104.speaker: Gale
Lorroakan_104.text: There is no need for me to bark. My actions will speak for themselves, in time.
Lorroakan_104.context: NodeContext: He does believe it, but he's blustering now

Lorroakan_141.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_141.text: Then go - act. I'll open a fine vintage in your name, once word of your failure reaches me.

Lorroakan_133.speaker: Gale
Lorroakan_133.text: Perhaps it was indeed wise to dissuade me from the Crown of Karsus - a jumped-up wizard drunk on promises of power is not enviable company.
Lorroakan_133.context: NodeContext: Discreet murmur to the player.

Lorroakan_198.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_198.text: What's that? I didn't quite catch the words, but your tone was clear enough.

Lorroakan_63.speaker: Gale
Lorroakan_63.text: Nothing at all, friend. I was merely admiring your ambition.

Lorroakan_169.speaker: Narrator
Lorroakan_169.text: *His suspicions confirmed, his curiosity settles into a sneer - he has seen through Gale's disguise.*

Lorroakan_244.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_244.text: Ah. I believe I recognise you. Gale of Waterdeep. Mystra's discarded lapdog, reduced to trailing after some adventurer. How you have fallen.

Lorroakan_208.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_208.text: Do you still pine for her? Run around trying to impress her, in the hope she'll take you back?

Lorroakan_75.speaker: Gale
Lorroakan_75.text: I'm my own man. I make my own choices.

Lorroakan_95.speaker: Gale
Lorroakan_95.text: Let him chase his prize if he wishes. We know of an even greater one that he is blind to - the Crown.
Lorroakan_95.context: NodeContext: Discreet murmur to the player.

Lorroakan_223.speaker: Gale
Lorroakan_223.text: Nothing, friend. Just a little trapped wind - I'm sure you understand.

Lorroakan_264.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_264.text: You're an arrogant fool. Immortality alone does not make a god.

Lorroakan_237.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_237.text: 'Equalising man and god' - noble words cannot hide a selfish intent, wizard.

Lorroakan_38.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_38.text: I'll go fetch her. I look forward to my reward.

Lorroakan_36.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_36.text: I know where she is. I might even be willing to tell you.

Lorroakan_259.speaker: Gale
Lorroakan_259.text: You'd give up her location, just like that? You're not actually considering betraying her, are you...?

Lorroakan_159.speaker: Shadowheart
Lorroakan_159.text: That was more than he strictly needed to know. You're not intending to surrender her over to him, are you...?

Lorroakan_124.speaker: Jaheira
Lorroakan_124.text: Aylin is a friend - to whom we owe our lives, I would remind you.

Lorroakan_256.speaker: Minsc
Lorroakan_256.text: You would betray Dame Aylin? Be you faithless, or simply foolish?

Lorroakan_246.speaker: Halsin
Lorroakan_246.text: Why tell him anything of Dame Aylin? Surely you do not intend to betray her...?

Lorroakan_276.speaker: Wyll
Lorroakan_276.text: Are you serious? Surely you won't hand Dame Aylin over to him.

Lorroakan_238.speaker: Karlach
Lorroakan_238.context: NodeContext: To player, urgently, warning them not to tell this villaiin anything else incriminating. A little exasperated like 'shouldn't you know better?'

Lorroakan_262.speaker: Lae'zel
Lorroakan_262.text: Ha! Betraying so quickly? Be careful your backstabbing arm doesn't get tired.

Lorroakan_84.speaker: Astarion
Lorroakan_84.text: Quick to hand someone over, aren't you?

Lorroakan_90.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Lorroakan_90.text: Surrendering a powerful ally to this preening wizard does not seem wise.

Lorroakan_100.speaker: Gale
Lorroakan_100.text: Ambitious wizards and vast power can be a dangerous mix. Careful what you share with him.

Lorroakan_137.speaker: Shadowheart
Lorroakan_137.text: She deserves better than to fall into his clutches. I owe her, in a sense.

Lorroakan_268.speaker: Jaheira
Lorroakan_268.text: Would you hand her over to have her wings pulled off by this self-inflated wretch?

Lorroakan_37.speaker: Minsc
Lorroakan_37.text: You would betray Dame Aylin? Be you faithless, or simply foolish?

Lorroakan_156.speaker: Halsin
Lorroakan_156.text: You broke Dame Aylin's shackles once before. Do not help this one to forge new ones for her.

Lorroakan_85.speaker: Wyll
Lorroakan_85.text: Please - you can't liberate Aylin from one master only to chain her to another.

Lorroakan_245.speaker: Karlach
Lorroakan_245.text: You better not be planning on giving her up. Not after everything she's been through.
Lorroakan_245.context: NodeContext: A warning to the player. And projecting a little wrt her own situation.

Lorroakan_33.speaker: Lae'zel
Lorroakan_33.text: Ha! Betraying so quickly? Be careful your backstabbing arm doesn't get tired.

Lorroakan_94.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_94.text: Good. Then you'll have no trouble fulfilling the contract to bring the Nightsong here.

Lorroakan_220.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_220.text: I'll tell her to come here - just to give her the satisfaction of ripping you to shreds.

Lorroakan_23.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_23.text: Do as I say, and you'll be rewarded beyond imagination. Fail, and you give up the prize to the next motivated mercenary to encounter my contract.

Lorroakan_74.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_74.text: The choice is yours, but make no mistake: I always get what I want.

Lorroakan_41.speaker: Karlach
Lorroakan_41.text: Dame Aylin is going to want to kick this guy's arse herself. Believe me.

Lorroakan_19.speaker: Jaheira
Lorroakan_19.text: Much as it pleases me to cause an archmage's tantrum, let us be sure we are ready to weather it - yes?

Lorroakan_254.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_254.text: Have it your way. I'll bring her here.

Lorroakan_272.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_272.text: Good. I was growing scared for you. The last person who disappointed me is suffering for it still.

Lorroakan_178.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_178.text: Do not return without my prize. Do you hear me? Good day.

Lorroakan_99.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_99.text: You aren't the only one who knows what's on offer for the Nightsong's retrieval. Consider carefully whether you'd like to see your fortune in someone else's hands.

Lorroakan_65.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_65.text: Someone who might slip into your camp at any moment, or harry you through street and inn until you're run ragged and surrender.

Lorroakan_123.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_123.text: The choice is yours: fortune or imminent death. I know you'll choose wisely.

Lorroakan_189.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_189.text: You heard me. The answer is no.

Lorroakan_101.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_101.text: Pity. Then again, perhaps word of your agonising death will draw your little friend to me.

Lorroakan_25.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Lorroakan_25.text: We should kill this petulant wizard on our own terms, and allow Nightsong the pleasure of taking his head. Do not provoke him.
Lorroakan_25.context: NodeContext: irritated, but prioritising tactical considerations

Lorroakan_53.speaker: Lae'zel
Lorroakan_53.text: Just smile and nod. We'll decide at our own leisure, not his.

Lorroakan_64.speaker: Wyll
Lorroakan_64.text: The wizard's a veritable geyser of rage. Provoke him, and he'll erupt.

Lorroakan_143.speaker: Shadowheart
Lorroakan_143.text: We can't do that - not after the lengths I already went through with her.

Lorroakan_181.speaker: Gale
Lorroakan_181.text: A shame to wizardry, this one. Still, we should exercise caution.

Lorroakan_186.speaker: Astarion
Lorroakan_186.text: We're all very impressed by your loyalty, but have we considered not aggravating the incredibly powerful archmage?

Lorroakan_196.speaker: Minsc
Lorroakan_196.text: I will admit I have not listened to a single thing the ginger wizard has said. But I do not like the way he says it.

Lorroakan_251.speaker: Halsin
Lorroakan_251.text: I'm glad you will not surrender an ally, but we should still be cautious around this one.
Lorroakan_251.context: NodeContext: 'this one' being lorroakan, who is asking the player to betray an ally to him

Lorroakan_13.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_13.text: I'll fetch her. I look forward to my reward.

Lorroakan_191.speaker: Astarion
Lorroakan_191.text: I do admire your directness, though. Quick and to the point.

Lorroakan_110.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Lorroakan_110.text: I have little affection for Nightsong, but I would have less for you if you gave her up without a fight.

Lorroakan_47.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_47.text: I'm sorry to tell you, but she's dead. Run through with a Sharran spear.

Lorroakan_102.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_102.text: Dead?! That cannot be. She - it - is immortal. A god!

Lorroakan_210.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_210.text: You don't know what you've done. And you never will.

Lorroakan_57.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_57.text: How exhausting it is, interacting with inferior minds and their vulgar motivations.

Lorroakan_91.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_91.text: She was a Selûnite held by Sharrans. Her death was inevitable.

Lorroakan_16.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_16.text: Is that meant to be some consolation? She - it - was the key to my immortality.

Lorroakan_213.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_213.text: How can this be - how can this be?! SHIT!
Lorroakan_213.context: NodeContext: He's just learned Nightsong is dead and is upset.

Lorroakan_30.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_30.text: She's been buried. Ended. Taken down. Offed. She's dead.

Lorroakan_15.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_15.text: I'm afraid the mighty Nightsong was no match for my magic. She's dead.

Lorroakan_232.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_232.text: You seem to know a great deal about her. Bring her to me, and I'll forgive your little fib about her fate.

Lorroakan_139.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_139.text: I regret to inform you the Nightsong is no more - killed in the Sharran temple where she was held.

Lorroakan_87.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_87.text: I've seen her - she was trapped by Ketheric Thorm. I left her there.

Lorroakan_122.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_122.text: You left her there?! Then go retrieve her, you imbecile. Or it will cost you a world of riches so vast you cannot even comprehend the loss.

Lorroakan_154.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_154.text: You can go now. Before I lose my temper.

Lorroakan_275.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_275.text: Tut tut, now. I do detest a liar.

Lorroakan_108.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_108.text: She must be an ally for you to try to mislead me. Bring her to me, and I'll forgive this momentary lapse of character.

Lorroakan_149.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_149.text: Get out of my face now.

Lorroakan_49.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_49.text: I can see you're in no place to have a civilised conversation. Return when an iota of sense has returned to you.

Lorroakan_106.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_106.text: Choose your next words carefully, friend. They determine the length of your very life.

Lorroakan_138.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_138.text: You will bring me the Nightsong. Won't you?

Lorroakan_284.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_284.text: Binding the Nightsong forever... How unoriginal. Need I recite the tale of Ketheric Thorm?

Lorroakan_183.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_183.text: First Ketheric, now you - there are easier ways to achieve immortality, you know.

Lorroakan_92.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_92.text: First Ketheric and now you. I thought wizards were supposed to be the smart ones?

Lorroakan_167.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_167.text: I know nothing. I swear it.

Lorroakan_258.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_258.text: Ach! Worthless. Leave, then. And do not return unless you bring the Nightsong in tow. It's not too late for you to become very rich. But you'll have to earn it.

Lorroakan_206.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_206.text: I do. And I can hand her over, for the right price.

Lorroakan_277.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_277.text: Finally. I've been waiting for someone with any measure of wits to heed my clarion call.

Lorroakan_17.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_17.text: It's quite simple. Bring the Nightsong here, and collect your reward.

Lorroakan_227.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_227.text: Why do you want her so badly?

Lorroakan_68.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_68.text: A clever contraption. Let me guess: like Ketheric Thorm before you, you wish to become immortal.

Lorroakan_279.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_279.text: Thanks for revealing your plan. I look forward to watching Dame Aylin rip you to shreds.

Lorroakan_98.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_98.text: That's an awful fate. I won't subject my friend to it.

Lorroakan_4.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_4.text: I couldn't bring her to you even if I wanted to.

Lorroakan_197.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_197.text: So was it you who picked up Nightsong's trail? I suppose you still have some talents, even if you are damaged goods. Where is it?

Lorroakan_204.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_204.text: I might tell you. But there is another matter I wished to ask you about.

Lorroakan_249.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_249.text: You stand in the presence of Gale of Waterdeep, Lorroakan. Mind your tongue.

Lorroakan_10.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_10.text: Not quite the enthusiastic welcome I was hoping for.

Lorroakan_45.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_45.text: You'll have more gratitude than you know how to count once the Nightsong is in my hands. Do you have it or not?

Lorroakan_11.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_11.text: What do you want with her?

Lorroakan_129.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_129.text: 'Her'. Fascinating. You've been to Shar's temple, haven't you? To the Shadowfell?

Lorroakan_35.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_35.text: I can take my answers from your corpse if you prefer. A surprising number of people are more forthcoming dead than alive.

Lorroakan_48.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_48.text: Then again, who will clean the mangled mess from my floor? So I'll ask again.

Lorroakan_226.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_226.text: And the Nightsong? Speak true, now, for I detest a liar.

Lorroakan_174.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_174.text: You speak as though you've seen the Nightsong yourself.

Lorroakan_46.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_46.text: Alas. I've paid for a good deal of very privileged information. Now I await the results of the generous contract I've commissioned.

Lorroakan_9.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_9.text: Answer now, or see what happens when fools misuse my valuable time.

Lorroakan_26.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_26.text: You must be the wizard Lorroakan.

Lorroakan_236.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_236.text: And you must have an answer to my request - if you want to keep your head, of course. The Nightsong. Do you have it or not?

Lorroakan_40.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_40.text: I see no Nightsong. Surely you wouldn't have entered my tower without the Nightsong in hand. Surely my worthless apprentice wouldn't have allowed you to waste my time.

Lorroakan_111.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_111.text: Your terrible tidings have cost me everything - my grand design, dashed to ruins.

Lorroakan_118.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_118.text: You have a job to do. So do it - quickly.

Lorroakan_131.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_131.text: Bring me what I seek - and quickly - or do not come back. Ever.

Lorroakan_114.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_114.context: NodeContext: The charisma fails; being a big brat

Lorroakan_267.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_267.text: Mark my words: the Nightsong is mine. With or without your help, she will ascend to her grand fate here, in this tower.

Lorroakan_112.speaker: Lorroakan
Lorroakan_112.text: You can get very rich along the way, or let someone else take what's rightfully yours. Choose wisely.

Lorroakan_248.speaker: Player
Lorroakan_248.text: You must be the wizard Lorroakan. I've heard a great deal about you.

Client003_0.speaker: Lester Farrower
Client003_0.text: Perhaps you can swap garlic for bloodstaunch? Worst case scenario you just wouldn't stop bleeding. And stink.
Client003_0.context: NodeContext: Preoccupied with his thoughts/thinking aloud

Client003_1.speaker: Lester Farrower
Client003_1.text: One moment - I'm trying to work out how many pinches of mugwort is equivalent to one of mothersleaf...
Client003_1.context: NodeContext: Preoccupied with his thoughts/working out the maths

AD_ClientsDiscussion_2.speaker: Hector Roba
AD_ClientsDiscussion_2.text: What do you mean 'not one for customer service'?

AD_ClientsDiscussion_1.speaker: Cappa Delourese
AD_ClientsDiscussion_1.text: I saw somebody go up to Lorroakan's tower last tenday - looked a proper fright when they came out.

AD_ClientsDiscussion_6.speaker: Hector Roba
AD_ClientsDiscussion_6.text: Surely you can't just go roughing up your customers? Especially if you're the one at fault!

AD_ClientsDiscussion_3.speaker: Hector Roba
AD_ClientsDiscussion_3.text: This is ludicrous! My complaints will be heard!

AD_ClientsDiscussion_10.speaker: Cappa Delourese
AD_ClientsDiscussion_10.text: Well, it might just be there's not much left - the Absolute's making people panic.

AD_ClientsDiscussion_8.speaker: Hector Roba
AD_ClientsDiscussion_8.text: Absolute or not, I still need my full complement of herbs - how am I supposed to do any healing without them?

AD_ClientsDiscussion_13.speaker: Cappa Delourese
AD_ClientsDiscussion_13.text: I'm sure you'll manage - it's not as if your cupboards are bare just yet.
AD_ClientsDiscussion_13.context: NodeContext: Getting a little annoyed with her friend now

AD_ClientsDiscussion_4.speaker: Hector Roba
AD_ClientsDiscussion_4.text: I shouldn't have to wait until I've got nothing left - I need to be prepared. We all do!

AD_ClientsDiscussion_7.speaker: Hector Roba
AD_ClientsDiscussion_7.text: No, I did not find what I'm looking for. Did you?

AD_ClientsDiscussion_0.speaker: Cappa Delourese
AD_ClientsDiscussion_0.text: Not a dicky bird. It's really quite disappointing.

AD_ClientsDiscussion_5.speaker: Hector Roba
AD_ClientsDiscussion_5.text: I've good mind to march up there and speak to Lorroakan myself.

AD_ClientsDiscussion_12.speaker: Cappa Delourese
AD_ClientsDiscussion_12.text: You might want to be careful - I've heard he's not really one for customer service.

NightsongSmash_0.speaker: Lorroakan
NightsongSmash_0.text: Getting back broken over Nightsong's knee / dying 3
NightsongSmash_0.context: NodeContext: Lorroakan gets his back broken by being slammed over Nightson'gs knee

NightsongSmash_2.speaker: Lorroakan
NightsongSmash_2.context: NodeContext: Being hoisted overhead roughly by Nightsong

NightsongSmash_3.speaker: Lorroakan
NightsongSmash_3.context: NodeContext: Dying/ gurgling, he's on 0 HP and is about to die

NightsongSmash_4.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongSmash_4.text: Lorroakan: you who would see me caged - you who would purchase my submission with profane gold!
NightsongSmash_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong approaches Lorroakan's dying body and speaks to him.NodeContext: (Lorroakan = loh-ROW-ah-kun)

NightsongSmash_1.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongSmash_1.text: Let every wicked magus, every vile murtherer, each slaver and misery-merchant see:
NightsongSmash_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: She scoops up his body and lifts it over her head in a military press

NightsongSmash_5.speaker: Nightsong
NightsongSmash_5.text: Dame Aylin is watching. She is indomitable. And when her face lights the shadows of your wrongdoing, you are broken by its beauty.
NightsongSmash_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: On the last line, she brings him down into a backbreaker and lets his body fall to the ground. NodeContext: Furious, then with heaving breath (Aylin = EY-lin)

ZombieNecromancy_0.speaker: Narrator
ZombieNecromancy_0.text: *The zombie is still watching. Still hungry.*

ZombieNecromancy_1.speaker: Narrator
ZombieNecromancy_1.text: *The newborn zombie gazes at you hungrily, pus drooling from its slack jaw.*
